Another super cool thing about JoBot, is that they have late hours EVERY day, so when you need a drink, snack, or tasty crepe, you have a spot to get your fix. Being at JoBot, you can easily have the feeling that you are on vacation somewhere really cool, and this is one of those places that you only wish you had back in your hometown. It sounds weird, but being at JoBot feels like a vacation, it's just relaxing, you're not rushed, and it's very laid back. The great news is, we have JoBot in our backyard, and I can take a mini-vacation anytime, and go there and relax. I am really grateful that we have locally owned gems like this in the 602. I really cannot imagine a situation where I would pick a chain over JoBot, Lola, or Giant Coffee. It's really nice to have a great drink, while supporting local Mom & Pops. That is what I call a win-win. Check out JoBot, you will not be disappointed.

This place is pretty awesome! Location is lovely for it is in the middle of the heart of Phoenix where action happens! Well done, JoBot. Well done. 

I ordered the chicken quesadilla and a Chai latte. 

The quesadilla was bomb! Better than I expected! AND it had cabbage in it, which was a first for me and I must say: DELICIOUS!  It caught me by surprise how yummy it tasted. 

My Chai tea latte was lovely. I just personally wish it was sweeter and stronger and I wish they had toffee nut so I can put two squirts of that lol

Bathroom was dark, scary, and dirty. YIKES! 

The staff was extremely friendly :)

This place is cool. I'll probably return!

Delicious crepes, good coffee, *excellent* hours.
Both times I've been there the service has been fine and delightfully-unStarbucksy (by which I mean humans work there, not robots).

I love this little street in Phoenix dubbed as the "Artsy District" by my friend who lives there. I walked in to this house that's turned in to the JoBot cafe/coffee house vibrantly playing Beats Antique and related tracks. I was instantly in love!!! I got a banana and nutella crepe to go which they wrapped up like a roti in a cup. I grabbed a few forks and knives on my way out and went to town - damn was it good. Top 5 crepes I've ever had in my entire life.

5 Yelps for the location, environment, one of the 5 best crepes ever, attitude, friendliness and hipster vibe. Fantastic - my only complaint is that it took 15 minutes to make me a crepe?

THIS has been a review by Gaurav

Crepes to die for!  Coffee made in house is amazing.. They have like 6 different teas.  Decor is in an old house, like the rest of Roosevelt Row area.

Def recommend to others!
Late night munchies....Got the Starwberries,Nutella and Bananas crapes  and Vegan Salad. Salad was so delicious. Crapes was decent. Not bad.  Open til midnight and 24hrs on the weekend! Yay

We decided to try this place in a whim for breakfast and my friend and I both got the sweet crepe with strawberries and nutella. For someone like me who normally isn't a big fan of crepes, I really enjoyed it. It wasn't burnt at all. The crepe was so soft and not too sweet. The warm nutella was delicious. I do wish that they would expand more their breakfast selection. I would come again.

Eww I will never go late night here for coffee. I was even scared to use the bathroom here. There are people hanging outside of the coffee house in the late night which makes it look ghetto. The inside is gross too, I would def get my late night coffee here to go. On the plus side this place is open later than starbucks.

Hahahha they have a sign on the door saying "Not Jobot" which was hilarious and confusing at the same time, their way of being funny. I actually did think for second before I entered. Hahahha. Super cool vibe and decor, the crowd seemed young and fun. It is in the art district after all. I had the latte, smooth and good. Also, the coffee was full bodied and smooth. Nice!

I stopped in Sunday afternoon for a late lunch & was pleasantly surprised. First if you can snag a space in the garage, it's 2 hours free parking. I love the high chair seating in over 2/3 of the restaurant. There are great street views from inside & outdoor seating, but in this 95 degree heat, it's to hot outdoors. I ordered the Yellow Curry Chicken with a side of home fries & chicken breast with a blueberry donut. The marinade & coconut milk really create a healthy & fantastic tasting meal highlighted by the steamed rice. The chicken was perfectly grilled, not dry at all. Home fires perfectly prepared and piping hot. They provide very sturdy to go boxes. Prices are very reasonable & the venue is very clean. Special note to the immaculate bathrooms, (with cool lighting) the staff does a wonderful job. They are extremely knowledgeable & professional. They have a robust wi-fi going on plus numerous power outlets. There many customers working in this place?

Jobot has become my go-to coffee-fix when ever I'm downtown. The iced toddy is the perfect fix, macchiato was precisely what I remembered a macchiato is supposed to be (thanks San Francisco for ruining me for anything less than excellent coffee)... & OMG the crepes! Try 'em all! Sweet/Savory, they're all delicious & quantifiable sized. Wonderful urban/hipster vibe, even my Mom liked it, good place for a hang out w/ friends, dates even (check out the other local art scenes while you're there), good, chill, laid-back place ;) Not to forget, also, Friday & Saturday, open all night! Now that it's fall, Sunday breakfasts are on, waffles & everything!

I wanted to like this place, but unfortunately, I can't even get a coffee here. I don't eat or drink sugar, so I opt for the sugar free sweeteners when I order coffee. This place, "doesn't believe in sugar free sweeteners" so they only have things like honey and other natural SUGAR. Looks like I won't be going here.

Good tea here, you can really taste the strength of the mint leaf. Great atmosphere, remind me of Silverlake back home in Los Angeles and this up and coming downtown Phoenix.

Crepes are made good too, good music. I feel like I am at home, literally it's a cooler historic home converted.
Coworkers' favorite lunch meeting spot. Picnic tables and crepes make for a very relaxed atmosphere. Still working our way thru the menu, but so far we love everything we've tried.

don't bother.

the employees are the worst. 

it's quite sad actually because the espresso drinks are out of this world, amazing. still, i won't be back. ever.
Coffe was decent.  I think their major attraction is the funkiness that they provide.  Fan of funk :)

Wow, worse service ever!  My girlfriend and I went there on Sunday morning. We traditionally frequent different coffee shops during the weekend and looked forward to their good coffee and crepes. I love the screen door and intimate feel of the place, so relaxing.

So we arrived and sat down, only to wait for 15 minutes (not an exaggeration) before we decided to leave. The barista didn't even acknowledge us until half way through that time. It would be different if it was screaming busy  but there was only two other couples sitting down ahead of us. I spend alot of time in coffee shops, this place may have good coffee but compared to service at Lux and Lola's; I'll take my business elsewhere in the future.

This used to be the best in town for a crepe. In fact, it used to be one of the best places in town period. While the coffee is still good, the menu changes have turned the food from fantastic to barely edible. I have been a weekly customer from the beginning.

My two favorite menu items were the D crepe (peanut butter & chocolate chip), and savory crepe #5 (pit smoked ham, swiss, honey dijon, & spinach). The D crepe has been removed from the new menu, and crepe #5's ham has been replaced with salty deli meat ham that tastes like cardboard. Also the crepe now has kale instead of spinach, which tastes like fibrous tooth floss. Oh, and there was a random egg thrown on top-- surprise!!

From what I can tell the new menu is an attempt to streamline the shop with a more "on the go" style menu. There is also a new cooler filled with soda and water, which I'm sure no one will ever use. Isn't it a coffee shop? Furthermore, the downsized menu has consolidated ingredients which are all much lower quality than before- surely to lower the food cost.

The end result? Cardboard crepes and drastically downsized menu featuring Oscar Meyer quality meat. I'm sad to say I will never be returning to what was once truly a Phoenix gem.

Showed up this Sunday and there was a dj playing some easy techno beats that even my mother could enjoy. Very pet friendly and our newborn enjoyed the sound levels as she slept through our late morning pick me up

There are only a few breakfast places in downtown Phoenix so when people talk about breakfast/brunch I think they tend to want to believe that the places down here are acceptable. I am wise to the game though, I understand that it is out of necessity that people support these places because otherwise, what are we gonna do? Not eat breakfast? This is not an option obviously. 

JoBot does a lot of things, each time I walk by there is something different going on and this is great. It should be no surprise that you will probably experience hipster-service here (blaring rap music inside at 8am, cold looks of disdian etc...). It is a universal fact that the coffee is terrible (before you attempt to refute this, walk down Roosevelt and take a random poll, I guarantee that 9/10 people will agree) It is almost the mantra of JoBot. I remember years ago stepping in here for a shot of espresso after a first-friday and being so underwhelmed that I didn't return for 4 years.

Recently I walked over to eat breakfast here, I paid 13$ for 2 eggs, 2 slices of bacon, 1 pancake and 1 glass of orange juice. It was OK, nothing special, I felt really let-down. I'm definitely open to spending some more time and money as it is a nice little place in the neighborhood but I will never eat breakfast here again.
I ordered the Jobot special sandwich which was great.  The atmosphere is hype, the music is loud (not the best place to focus) and it was busy on a Monday night.

Cool place. Great coffee. Only thing I would change is the staff. They almost seem snobby or just don't really really care about making people happy. Other than that cool environment delicious coffee and green tea with munt.

Came here for brunch a week ago.  The food is great (though none too abundant).  The coffee is also very good.  The service was definitely sub-par.  I'm very patient when it comes to a mess up here or there, but after  notifying them three times (yes, 3!) over the course of an hour after we placed our order that we thought our order might have gotten lost, we were informed that the kitchen had still not gotten our order.  It was very frustrating to see people eating next to us who had arrived a half hour after us while we were still waiting for our food.

The staff seemed like very nice people, but they *really* dropped the ball with us.  We were a party of three and by way of apology they gave my one friend a $10 gift certificate.  I'm glad they were kind enough to give him that, but this reviewer certainly left without any reason to give them a second chance for the hour of starvation and precious wasted time.
Cold brew coffee was amazing. The breakfast burrito was awesome.

I have jobot coffee 4/5 stars only because I absolutely loved the original jobot. The original jobot coffee house was located nearby in a unique house full of personality. Jobot has recently moved down the road and is located on the bottom floor of a condo complex. Still a cools building, coffee is good- food was tasty. It's just not the same!

Fantastic atmosphere! It's like a hipster took over grandmas house for the weekend. Good music, great seating by the fireplace. I only tried their chai because it was late. It was good, had a good spice. It wasn't a sweeter chai, but still worth it since it is made completely in house.

I didn't try the coffee, but when the barista would refill the grinder's hopper with beans I could smell the roast, which was delightful. 

Again, I can't get over the atmosphere. It's a cozy, yet also creative. I'd like to come back during the day and order some food and sit on the patio.

I love coming into JoBot for coffee on first Fridays or whenever we are in area.  The employees that worked there are always really friendly and they have a great variety of coffee and crepes.  

JoBot is in a really cool old house in downtown phoenix.  They have a couple of chairs inside and tables outside the shop.  I hear that they have awesome crepes too.  One of these days I will try one. My favorite thing to drink here is just the plan coffee.  The reason why is because the coffee is always fresh. 

If you ever downtown for first Fridays you should head over to JoBot and have some coffee and Crepes.

Mainly I like the hours here.  The people that work here are usually pretty nice.  The guy with beard and the leather jacket especially.  Occasionally someone will come off a little rude or snobby, but it's definitely not the norm. Also occasionally the music is too hard or too loud.  I sound like a boring old man when I say that , but 9 times out of 10 I go to a coffee shop to relax and work on something. Overall this is a nice locally owned place

The coffee is decent. The cappuccino is really good! But I won't be back. We've been there a hand full of times and every time I have been there the barista- same one - has been on the unfriendly side. The first couple of times I thought maybe she was having a rough day. That's definitely not the case. She's just rude.

the rustic setting of this craftsman bungalow on 5th street acts as a cozy destination in the Roosevelt district. Upon walking up the steps and into the house amidst the sounds of folkesque alt. music wafting out to the street, you know this is a real indie kinda coffee shop/creperie. The crepes served at JoBot are delish with around 10 savories and almost the same number with the sweets. With a wide variety on their menu, a great selection of hot bevvies, some hansen natural soda types as well as a good selection of jarritos, this is a good place to stop by, sit back, eat a crepe and either have a hot drink during an odd cold night in Phoenix or sip a refreshing jarrito to recover from the hot summer day.Recommendations are the #8 machaca pulled pork, and the #9 root beer pulled pork for the savory and the go to banana with nutella for the sweet. So, if you find yourself close to JoBot and are craving a crepe, stop by because it's worth the calories and the yum factor. Open late nights weeknights, and 24 hours Fridays, Saturdays.

I'm giving this such a high rating because of the coffee. While they don't put the ingredients in (you add the cream and sugar yourself) it's just absolutely amazing. The best ice coffee I've had in the greater Phoenix area.

Seriously I feel really badly about it, like they are cheating and they are giving me something that resembles coffee but is somehow 10 times better!

It's delicious and the whole place has a whole "Stay here and type on your laptop" sort of vibe... Just a wonderful spot.

Pros:
Good crepes
Prime location along the Roosevelt Arts District
Good place to study or meet up with friends
Fun people-watching

Cons:
Feels a bit more hippie than hipster
I have gotten weird looks from staff and never a smile
The house looks/feels a bit dingy and grimy, which results in me not wanting to imbibe in drinks/food made in such a place. Cleanliness is important to me.

This is a nice place to study and just go for some food. It has a nice view of the street and the environment is welcoming. I tried the black bean spread crepe with pesto which was really good. Their cold brew coffee is ok, and could be a little bit more flavorful. Maybe ask for light ice if you like a more flavorful coffee.

I can't believe that I've taken so long to get around to reviewing JoBot. Maybe it's because I don't want you to know how amazing it is. They make the best coffee in CenPho and their crepes are to die for. But don't go here, seriously.

Hands down best BLT ive ever had. It was amazing! Chef Casey is a BAMF! Their coffee is on point too.

*Phoenix Foodies Approved!

Ask anyone who truly knows the Roosevelt Row neighborhood, and chances are John Sagasta's name will come up.  With good reason.  Sagasta is one of the die hards.  One of those who saw the neighborhood's potential and took a chance on opening up a slew of different small businesses when plenty of people undoubtedly thought he was nuts to do so.  Among his first offerings was Jobot on 5th Street.  A long time and wildly popular staple in the neighborhood, it sadly closed around Christmas time in 2016 due to the landlord having other plans for the space.  Not even a week later however, Sagasta has brought Jobot back (albeit at a new address).  The morning after their big grand reopening, I decided to check out their new space and grab some breakfast.

Jobot took over a space formerly occupied by another popular Downtown coffee spot called Oliver's Sophisticated Bean.  Oliver's abruptly closed just after Christmas 2016, giving Sagasta the opportunity to swoop in and save Jobot from oblivion.  Jobot's opening on First Friday was a mob scene so I opted to wait to give their new place a try until morning.  If you'd spent any amount of time at Oliver's in the past, you could be forgiven for thinking the space hadn't really changed all that much since Jobot took over.  You can tell that Sagasta and his staff pretty much scrambled to get this place open quickly as there's still a lot of work to be done.  The old Oliver's signage is still all over the building and some of the Jobot furniture and decor is still being moved around (often mismatched with the old Oliver's setup).  Let's just say the new location is a work in progress.

I was the first customer of the day on Saturday morning.  Everytime I've been to Jobot in the past, it was the crepes that had my undivided attention.  I think I've pretty much had all of their crepe varieties at least once (and they're all delicious).  However today, I opted for a different route.  Today it was the Jo-Mama Breakfast Sandwich that spoke to me.  Egg, ham, cheddar cheese, tomato, avocado, spinach, and what I believe was honey mustard sauce all on an english muffin.  Came with a side potato cake.  Total cost plus a water was $9.  Dynamite sandwich and as messy as you'd expect.  Love the sauce on this thing.  And for those who might've partied a little too hard on First Friday, a perfect hangover cure.

The food menu, much like the new location is a work in progress as many of their old standby items weren't available yet as of this review.  For those nostalgic for the feel of Jobot's old location in the old row house on 5th Street, the new location will be something of an acquired taste.  The new space is set in what is arguably now Roosevelt Row's most gentrified corner with new development popping up everywhere.  But if there's one thing Sagasta brings to the table that other Downtown business owners might lack, it's credibility.  The credibility to see an idea through and invest the blood, sweat and tears necessary to make a concept work.  Sagasta did just that with Lost Leaf, Melt, Flowers Beer Wine Deli, and now he's at it again with Jobot.  With time, I'm quite certain Jobot will truly make this new spot their own.

We stumbled upon this place as it was in walking distance from where we parked and we did not have time to wait an hour for Matt's Big Breakfast. I was a little nervous as we walked down the streets to get there since the neighborhood was a bit sketchy and my mom and step-father aren't very adventurous people.  

Jobot is housed in an old craftsman house. Kinda strange to first walk in but the friendly staff makes all doubts disappear. You have the option to get any combination served in a crepe, on a salad, or in 3 corn tortillas like tacos. The menu was limited but once reading over it you realize that there is something for  everyone. 

 I ordered the peanut butter, raspberry jam, and banana crepe (which was amazing and the perfect amount of PB), while my boyfriend & step-father had The Rancher in a crepe, and my mom ordered the Monte Cristo as tacos. Everyone cleaned their plates! The kitchen welcome substitutions, there was outside seating, their OJ was to die for, and they even had Martinelli's apple juice.

We left happy & full - a perfect combination.
Not loving the new location. Food is still good but they don't have same vibe or quality. Still good to support a local.

Lovely artsy spot. Right next door to Lost Leaf.
Probably the best coffee in Phoenix. 
Solid espresso.

The Songbird Coffee & Tea House (SCTH) sits directly on Roosevelt Street sharing such distinction with two other coffee shops namely, Tammie Coe Cakes and Lola's Coffee (just off, Red Hut Coffee, JoBot Coffee, and Fair Trade Cafe). SCTH shares a space with with an art gallery and leather works manufacturing space. SCTH has a large window front facing the road (like Lola's) where you can perch and ponder passing traffic and gaze at the Phx downtown skyline, to include the Valley Ho. (Matt's Big Breakfast's FORMER location had a similar such lovely view...no longer.) SCTH carries baked goods from a favorite local bakery and each time I visit, other patrons make a point of extolling the degree to which they enjoy their own purchase.

Today I had a Cortado (see the posted pic). My first Cortado was served by Sam, of the (now known as Demi Coffee) Mud Dauber Coffee Shop on 16th St at The Hive. I now head out towards the downtown Phoenix farmers market.
Always a perfect.time to come. Never too busy and always delicious food and drinks at hand. Peaceful and wonderful. Plain and simple.

-Root beer pulled pork, jalapeno-cilantro slaw with fresh pineapple crepe

It already got me at ROOT BEER pulled pork...but the jalapenos really got Jal-Up-En-O tastebuds because the heat was the real deal! (Don't forget to use their home-made salsa.)

This crepe was truly the perfect combo of fruity heat because the jalapeno and pineapple balanced each other out.  Sip on some unsweetened iced tea and cut up that next bite of heat!

If you're in downtown Phoenix and you're looking for a non-touristy spot, check this out! ESPECIALLY if you are near Roosevelt Street, where all the art is. The host was also helpful with making suggestions....even told me about FREE MUSEUM WEDNESDAY at the Phoenix Art Museum and the Heard Museum.

If you're averse to hipsters, you might as well look away from this review right now.  JoBot is easily the most hipster joint I've been to downtown.  The customers, the staff, hipsters everywhere.  I've lived downtown for over a year now so I'm used to seeing them around.  And being that JoBot is located right in the heart of the super artsy Roosevelt Row, it should probably come as no surprise that you would see that type of crowd here.  Not only am I not a hipster, I don't drink coffee.  So what am I doing here for breakfast on a Sunday morning you ask?  One word.  Crepes.

Just south of Roosevelt on 5th Street, JoBot Coffee occupies one of a number of old historic homes that have been converted to a number of different uses.  Melt turned a house into an ice cream parlor, Lost Leaf turned a house into an art gallery/bar with an impressive craft beer selection, while JoBot went the coffee house route.  JoBot has a nice roomy patio outside that can seat plenty, though during the summer its probably not ideal (even with the umbrellas).  Inside its fairly small, but comfortable as they do a good job keeping it cool in there.  Here you order your food and drink at the counter, then grab a seat wherever (similar to Vovomeena's breakfast setup).

As I said earlier, I came to try out the crepes.  I went with Crepe F (cinnamon, apple, & granola drizzled with honey).  I also got Scramble 2 (an egg scramble with chorizo, mozzarella, & spinach).  The scramble came with a tortilla and some wicked hot salsa in case you wanna make a burrito out of it.  Also got an OJ to wash it all down.  Total price was about $15.  The crepe was absolutely awesome.  Fluffy and light while the apple and honey paired beautifully with the house made granola.  Lots of different flavors going on with this one and all of them delicious.  The scramble was also impressive.  I'm not a huge spinach guy, but mixed in with the chorizo gave the scramble a nice gentle texture and there was no shortage of cheese.  The salsa was crazy hot so i didn't mix too much of that in there, and the scramble tasted great on its own anyway.  After all was said and done, I was full and happy.  Excellent breakfast to start my Sunday.

One thing that really sets this place apart from other downtown eateries is they're open around the clock on the weekends.  This is something Downtown Phoenix could use a lot more of.  And yet despite this, the place was pretty clean and orderly and the service I received was friendly and attentive (unlike Denny's and some fast food joints I've been to at early hours).

So make jokes about hipsters if you must, but from my experience, the breakfast here is legit.  Great flavors, fresh tasting ingredients, and locally sourced.  A nice laid back neighborhood haunt.  They also have lunch and dinner items too which I will be sure try next time I'm here.  And yes, they even have lunch & dinner crepes.  Can you tell I'm a crepe fanatic yet?
When Jobot has a generator and can make your morning coffee after a construction accident knocks out all the power in your neighborhood. If that doesn't earn 5 stars I don't know what does.

Love it
Great coffee place. Pastries and food
The type of place Phoenix needs
Great music vibe

We've all been there.  You've been drinking a little too much and the bar closes. You get hungry (I call them the drunchies) and you are willing to eat almost anything. You just want something really good. We made the mistake of coming to JoBot Coffee for Crepes.  We ordered the #1 (Braized Beef, Mozzarella, Swiss, Caramelized Onions, Bell Pepper, Peppercini) the #2 (Chorizo, Fried Egg, Mozzarella, Spinach, Salsa) and the B. (BANANA + NUTELLA + WHIP). The crepe wasn't hot even though it was made "fresh", everything tasted bland and it was not satisfying. Decor was great, service was great and the fact they are open 24 hours on the weekend is a huge plus! However, I'd try something better for your drunchies. For some reason, all of our stomachs hurt that day right after as well. That could just be a coincidence, I suppose.

If you find yourself wandering the streets of down town phoenix late one evening, no, you're probably not homeless you were likely just hopping from bar to bar and can't remember. 

Don't fret because JoBot's lights are still on late into the night. While I can't say exactly just how late "late" is because I haven't payed too close attention to that minor detail and no one has posted it here on yelp yet. I can say they've been open every time I have visited after 11pm.

Mental note to self, next time at JoBot find out about hours and update yelp. Is it considered a mental note if I just wrote it down? I'm also not so sure it was to self either as I plan to post this review sometime soon. 

Anyway.

Give any of their crepes a try, they're all fairly good; although, I do prefer the savory crepes over the sweet crepes here. I truly can't believe I just said that actually, since most of my other reviews are for frozen yogurt and cupcakes, at least that's what I tried to order and was told "We don't actually serve frozen yogurt here sir. Would you like to try our crepes?"

Loved the chorizo and egg crepe - twas the perfect combination of everything they combined together to make the crepe. I'm pretty sure it was part chorizo, part egg, part cheese and part crepe. But then again it was a late night and I did just swing by after visiting Lost Leaf next door.

I hear they serve excellent coffee too, but I tend to stick to tea and pastries. Happy wandering my yelping friends! Hope to stumble into you sometime while chowing down on one of their tasty crepes.

I have been to the new location a few times since it has opened and so glad it stayed in the neighborhood!  Friendly staff, cool vibe, delicious Italian sodas (my drink of choice) and tasty crepes...all the makings of a great neighborhood hangout!

One of the great thing about working in the downtown area is there are some great options when you just need to get out of the office. Jobot is a great option with plenty of table space and indoor and outdoor seating. There were several of us and they have some big tables which make it easy to spread out your work. The space is industrial but comfortable. The staff is friendly and no one rushes you out the door.

I grabbed a bottled soda and a chocolate chip cookie. I also tried the peppermint mocha. I'm not a big coffee fan but it was good. I didn't order from their menu but it all looked and smelled good and was reasonably priced.

On a side note....I don't get the chair next to the toilet in the bathroom. Was someone supposed to come in with me and supervise?

Is your inner hipster screeching to come out? It is clawing at you to visit a vintage-esque/non-corporate influenced establishment? Do you want to be served coffee in a non-branded cup and drink it on the lawn of a historical house nestled in the cracks of the central city? Do you want to sit with non conformists, neo hippies. "too cool to care but I am here to be cool" type people?

Go to Jobot and feed your hispter ego. It's cute, yummy and a nice little experience in the center of Roosevelt Row. Love the little hipster inside you. He/She needs love too :)

Having read the reviews I was super psyched to try this place. I thought it would be super eclectic, but worth it. I feel it lies somewhere between 2 and 3 stars cause it was just okay. 

The place itself actually seems dirty... which messes with my clean freakness.  It looks like an old house that has not been taken care of.   

My coffee was the only thing worth talking about... which is probably a good thing because that's the specialty. 

The food was average and not very flavorful, and it took quite awhile. Was worried about how sanitary the kitchen was considering the state of  the public areas. 


eh.

Obviously a college hang out. Surprised it passed a health check. Food was overly salty and quite bland. Friend ordered the hungry man breakfast and got an average sized pancake, fried egg and a small size of potatoes. She kept asking for hot sauce but they only had sciracha yet wouldn't bring it out. Why was this place busy???  Lousy service and lousy food. Coffee wasn't impressive either. Music very loud and lots of smokers outside. Could not enjoy the company. Bathrooms were gross.

My son and I came before our last day at Comicon. He got the traditional crepe with strawberries and bananas and absolutely loved it ($7.50). Literally licked the plate. I got the breakfast burrito ($8.50, don't let the picture fool you I took it long after cutting it) it was piping hot and delicious. I'm picky about my chorizo and this one was very very tasty. Along with my $3 brunch mimosa. It was a win for us!

Great iced coffee & chai late. Had breakfast on Sunday and it was outstanding. All local products. This area has many local artists and reminds me of the Haight in S F. Well worth the triip "off the main roads" highly recommend
Great food and atmosphere!   We had a strawberry crepe and biscuits & gravy, both were amazing!

What a great find in downtown Phoenix! Located on 6th st in a historic house, this little jewel serves fresh coffee, bakery items, and breakfast dishes. Their veggie egg scramble was my favorite! Nothing starts the day like veggies in the AM! Can't wait to try the rest of the menu items!

I am giving this place 4 stars not for the food necessarily, or the coffee ... but actually for the idea, the space and the fact that its open 24/7 on the weekends! I guess this place is pretty awesome for that, a great space to share a meal, a cup of coffee and do some work at any time you feel like it. 

Definitely a needed concept in the Bay Area where things are busier and I do find myself wanting coffee ALMOST 24/7.

I had their classic crepe, which was just lemon and sugar, but the batter I wasn't a fan of because it's way too chewy and more like ... a burrito wrap than a crepe. The flavors were just ok. The americano I had was good but it wasn't amazing. However, like I said, great place that I worked in for about 2 hours, took some meetings too!

A cool post punk era coffee bar moves from a cool beat up old house on 5th Street and takes over a spot in a multi-million dollar condo complex on 3rd Street. Whats not to love? The coffee and the food rocks and the douche bags make themselves scarce.
The sunrise drink (espresso over oj) is really good. The basmati red lentil cake is a solid 10!

First time visit and we were not disappointed...entirely. We ordered the chicken tinga crepe, pico scramble w/ side of chorizo & potato hash, and a Nutella crepe minus the banana. The crepes were delicious...the pico scramble & hash was cold so we sent it back. They returned with a plate that looked like they threw the same food into a frying plan to reheat it. NOT COOL...nor sanitary!! It was sent back again and made fresh....DELISH!! Tabitha was the bomb.com making sure the situation was rectified. So, I am only reducing by 1 star and we will definitely return. And I forgot to mention that Tabitha makes a mean iced tea.

By far my favorite downtown coffee spot. I head here right after all my photoshoots. The crepes are fantastic and they have the best Scones I've ever had! I'm always meeting nice people and having great conversations. If you love the classic coffee shop feel then this is the place to be!
Very cute little place! Food was delicious! Loved it so much we are their twice while we were in town visiting!

Breakfast til midnight:  I'm there!  

My friend & I just finished listening to jazz at The Nash. So we yelped nearest coffee/food served after 10pm.  

I know!  I know!  Not gonna sleep with cold brew in my system soooo late but it sounded so good with my Chilaquiles.  And I was right on both haha!!

Chilaquiles: three eggs scrambled with hatch chile verde sauce & tortilla chips topped w/pico de gallo, cabbage & Cotija cheese with side of breakfast potatoes.  Either we were really hungry or it was really good?!? Hmmmmm must be both!!!  My friend kept eating my yummy potatoes. Both had a nice kick to it. 

Cool relaxed vibe & nice staff. People were on their laptops, playing board games or just drinking some brew (alcoholic & non) with friends. Indoor & outdoor seating. Even saw a fan outdoors for when it's warmer I believe.  We definitely enjoyed our food & drink.

I like the vibe here. It's an old house made café. Today my hunger led me here due to one drive by Matt's looked like I would be waiting a while to get fed. I knew from the get-go I wanted ice coffee (love my morning crack), some Yelpers said their (Toddy) was good. Next I attempted to order the (B&G) but the girl replied "No you won't. We're are out!" I reopen the menu and blurted out (breakfast -burrito). Paid and went to find a lid for my coffee, only over hear the kitchen yell out "You know we're out of Pico for the burrito". I went out on a limb and accepted it. Bad choice on my part. I felt as if my toddy was decaf and my food was par only because of the side of great salasa it was accompanied with. It was Monday tho,   I'll try you on a Friday.
The sweet crepe...nutella and strawberries...was just as good!  Their Italian Sodas are delicious making this a go to place in Phoenix for me!

Meh, it's an OK place to meet a friend for a fresh coffee or tea. They do make the teabags by hand so that's worth a visit. It is a major hipster joint and the staff have bad attitudes, even to their regular customers. I had one of their chocolate chip and peanut butter crepes which was decent. They do make a good chai latte tea and the coffees are strong. 
In 2014 they received a bad health dept review, so there's that. Forget about sitting outside unless you chain smoke or want to sit in something sticky. No fresh air surrounds the front door or patio, just clouds of cigarette smoke. Depending on the staff, the music can suck too. 
Not my favorite place but it is a local business and I'm all about supporting them.

Good vibes! The coffee and crepes are delicious. I've been there to study a few times and it is always pretty quiet. You definitely get the hipster scene here. Service can be a bit better. The PA system was playing some pretty fantastic music so that is a plus. Overall great local place to enjoy some delicious coffee or beer. Most importantly try their Banana Nutella crepe. AMAZING!!!
Decent pancakes. A bit overpriced.i wasn't really taken by the atmosphere here. Hipster.

I really, really wanted to like this place when I went, but it just didn't happen. I went on a nice peaceful Sunday morning to meet some friends and discuss an upcoming project we are working on. I parked my car and walked up to JoBot only to hear club  music blasting from a D.J. in the front sitting area. All I could think was, please let my friends be inside because I cannot listen to club music first thing in the A.M. I could only think how much worse it would be if I was hungover. Thank goodness my friends were inside. 

When I walked inside, I really liked the old house feel, but the place could have seriously used a good scrubbing.  It felt grimy and dingy rather than fresh and vintage.  I am a tea drinker, so I was a bit disappointed with their tea selection. It was nothing to write home about.  My friends were in the back room and as I walked over to them there was a spot in the floor I almost fell through - I'm not kidding. And I am not a heavy girl either - 115 lbs. The floor boards were stripped away and there was a thin layer of old wood between me and the crawl space. I about pissed myself when I stepped on it and felt the wood bend and start to give. Needless to say it was not the relaxing leisurely Sunday morning I had in mind.
Very friendly staff and fast service. My friend and I got crepes and coffee and both were delicious.

There are some things to know about Jobot. The service is a bit relaxed and not rushed. This is not Starbucks. Thank God. The atmosphere is fantastic, the music not obtrusive, the tea wonderful. Haven't had the food yet. Check them out. Pretty sure you will love it if you're looking for a relaxed, cool spot to hang out.

CREPES! Wow they are all delish, and their the only place I know of close by that has them. Iv'e probably had everything on their menu by now and it's all amazing. (Im downtown often for coffee, school, and friday art walks.) And the best thing is - their always open whenever I go by. Coffee is great, lattes are super rich 
They just took out a huge main wall that separated the two rooms so now, its nice and big, and open. 
Always good. Always interesting people.

I come here 3-5 times a week. Not because theybtreat me well inky because I can get coffee and sometimes drinks late. Amazing how I can remember everyone who works here but they act like they have never seen be before as I tell them I come here several times weekly. Still continue to treat me pourly even though I tell them before hand my intentions. I really would like this place and I spend nealry 50$ a week here and they continue to seem like I'm not a valued customer. If only be coffee was open later I would not come her nearly ever.

These hard workin freaks kick ass !!
Best food and coffee anytime you want 
Never a disappointment

Kind of disappointed with the iced chai latte I received. It was watery and bland. If I end up going to this cafe again, I'll probably stick to regular brewed coffee. 

Aside from that, the place itself is cool, located in a convenient place on Roosevelt Row. Looks like a chill place to study, work, or hang out at.
Went for their chi latte recommended by someone absolutely great. Super friendly confortable and great for vegans. Dog friendly patio and the place next door has live bands coffee and live music!

this is a phoenix hipster spot they serve coffee drinks tea breakfast and lunch. this morning having jury duty i ventured into the big city and took the yelpers suggestion and tried this joint out ,its a cool old house in a neighborhood full of other cool old houses all turned into artsy type studios and retail.I had the choritzo gravey and bisquet w/2 eggs and yummy potatos the service was good and effeciente and friendly. personally i thought the biscuits were a bit dry but all in all i enjoyed myself

Our first visit to JoBot and I'm happy we made the drive.  A nice location - I love when I don't have to worry if there will be enough room to sit and here there is plenty of space!  I ordered the chorizo crepe and it was amazing!  First bite and I declared that I knew I had the best dish on the table!  After testing a bite of the waffle ( get taste and texture) and the JoRito (gigantic and a really good taste) I am still sure that I won.  Best order of the morning!  I can't wait to come again!

Very retro yet hipster. Nice outdoor seating. I had Crepe C. It was excellent. Nice balance of Nutella and strawberries plus their whipped cream was great! Good portion, but if you're hungry one is not enough. Prices are very appropriate. 5 stars for a quick, cool breakfast.

My husband and I came here for breakfast on a Sunday. We arrived around 8 and were pleased to see that there were plenty of seats. We ordered and chose a seat outside. I really enjoyed my Scramble Z (eggs, cheddar, and roasted veggies). I loved the fact that they put in zucchini and eggplant as well as green peppers and onions. It was served with a delicious flour tortilla and very spicy salsa. I also ordered a classic crepe and devoured it. My husband ordered Crepe F. He said it was a little too sweet but ate the whole thing! Then he got a scone. He really liked that. Overall, it was really good, but if you are a picky eater or like a lot of options you may be disappointed by the rather small menu.

some of the staff is wonderful. on the other hand some of them aren't. i am tired of not being able to smile and look at my server in the eye and say "hello". apparently that is not ok to do with some of the staff. particularly the big dude with the pony tail. i am a pretty forgiving person and i understand we all have our bad days...but after the fourth time serving me, do you still have to be rude? one time i asked what kind of teas they have and i get the look-at-the-ceiling-rolled-eyes  and he points and says "there they are." ...a few different containers of teas with labels on them which i can't read. another issue i have is that it is not always 'customer first.' if i'm standing around and don't know where to order, with a bunch of people and they don't know where to order either, help us figure it out....we are the ones ultimately PAYING your PAYCHECK. another issue is the bipolarness of some of the staff, one day the blonde chick is nice, the next she's rude. why would you be rude? i'm paying for my drink, i'm giving YOU YOUR PAYCHECK money. this is a problem that many coffee shops have, a rude staff. however, the rest of the staff is quite nice and awesome:) and really friendly. really there's only two bad eggs. if they would only be nice 95% of the time instead of 10% i would be much happier. again i am a very forgiving person so i hope that they read this and shape up.

I work for the Phoenix Fire Department and you will see me here almost every Saturday night. The coffee is exceptional and the customer service is alwyas nice. Its a nonpretentious douchebag place and the vibe is no corporate. Its a nice change of pace in my life and I enjoy it. You will also find me here now on random nights with my laptop watching a movie and enjoying a coffee as I am just so relaxed when I am here.

Great coffee, good atmosphere and a great addition to downtown,,

Coffee, crepes and cool hipsters, You can have a taste of all there with just one stop here.

Inside of a old house is JoBot, Prices are decent service is quick and nice and the crepe did not skimp on the basil. Prices are like all coffee shops which means not a great deal but I guess you pay for the experience.

Inside are a few tables and chairs and a old upright piano. Outside are school style picnick tables which could really benefit from a back. Or maybe I am just getting too old to sit here.

Authentically Hippie is the best way to describe this place! I have been living in Phoenix for 2 years now and this place is still where I go to any given weeknight. Let me make this review direct and short. 

Food - awesome! lots of choices and real. 
Price - reasonable. about $8-11 for an entree and $3-5 for coffee. 
Service - polite, friendly, young and progressive! 
ambience - this place has a unique character. it being in an old house and it feels like your in a living room! great place to hang out and do some needed READING! 

Recommendation - my GO TO spot in Phoenix for sure. Try this place out especially when you are looking for a place that has character and hippie feel to it. I honestly feel like I am at Silver Lake, Los Angeles whenever I go here.

We decided to make our way here for Sunday brunch and try out their food. We had been here once before for an afternoon coffee and hadn't been too impressed with the coffee or atmosphere, but we wanted to give their food a try. We are so glad we did, their food is delicious! We had their biscuits and gravy, breakfast burrito with chorizo, a brown sugar and cinnamon crepe, and a pancake for our son. All were amazing and scrumptious. They are large portions and you will not leave hungry. The burrito was full of goodness and the salsa on the side was nice and spicy and a little went s long way. The biscuits and gravy were different but good. And our 7 month old loved the pancake. It was so fluffy and perfectly cooked. 
Here are the reasons they are only getting 4 stars and not five:
~Customer service was not great. I don't know if they were overwhelmed, but they had an attitude and I did not feel welcome. 
~ Coffee is not amazing. When their main product is coffee I really want to be blown away and I wasn't. The cold brew was average, it did have a lot of flavor though. Their drip. Offer was just really weak. 
~ They have a great outdoor space, but it is ruined by all the smokers.

This place is awesome!  This place is what I consider a true coffee house.

Top three tips:

1) excellent locally roasted beans.

2) fantastic in house bakers -- amazing baked goods!!!  Best brown butter donuts ever!!!

3) the exhibit local art.

My friends and I made a late night stop to JoBot's for some tasty grub after a night of fun in downtown Phoenix. A charming, rustic American Craftsman Bungalow style home greeted us along with a chill, hipster, casual diner atmosphere. Biscuits and gravy are one of my top ten guilty food indulgences and I had been oogling over the menu for the last week over JoBot's chorizo with red gravy version. Most of my restaurant choices are premeditated, yes, strange, I know. Welcome to the life of a food obsessed person.  To my dismay, they were out of gravy. I defaulted to my second choice, the yummy Jo-Mama's breakfast sandwich and a tasty brown butter donut. JoBot's satisfied my late night cravings and I can't wait to come back and try their morning picker upper!

Sure, it doesn't have to homey feel that the old place has, but the quality is still as good, and the place is bright and nice.
Drinks (Tea lattes...) are well done, quickly made, and there was a long line when I went one cold morning.

It's a nice mid century bungalow turned coffee shop.  

I've read a good review by Anthony P. more than a year ago and it's been on my list.  I didn't know it's two doors down by my fave installation art gallery, Eye Lounge.

First off, I had the hot chai latte, hubby had the regular latte and my little cutie pie a Strawberry Italian Soda.  The sitting outside had plenty of room for hanging out.  They also bring out your food.

So, people rave about the crepes and I had to find out for myself what it's all about.  We ordered the crepe banana/nutella and cinnamon apple honey (without the granola).  It was okay.  The crepe was hard and dry.  I'm more into the soft and buttery ones.  I don't think they add enough eggs and butter in there.  The fillings were delicious.  I'm not a fan of their crepes. 

We will be back for their yummy drinks!

This place was awesome sauce! Got a Nutella strawberry filled crepè with a quad iced honey lavender lattè. It was all delicious! And the quaint little homey atmosphere inside gives off the prefect vibe to start your day..I will be recommending this place to all my friends and co workers!

New location just in time for my trip to Phoenix. My Airbnb hosts suggested Jobot, but I saw it was closed. The location is downtown, very modern. It's huge, with tables and barstools looking onto downtown Phoenix. I got a regular drip coffee for $3 and it was huge. They have stevia, which is a plus. I didn't eat here, but they have a full kitchen. In comparison to all the coffee shops I've been to, this one is okay, but it's not one I would frequent.

We came here friday morning for crepes to celebrate my daughters birthday. We got the nutella/strawberry crepe, and the ricotta/citrus/berry jam crepe, they were delicious, large and had plenty of filling. My daughter wanted a caramel macchiato, and the lovely young woman who took our order suggested the caramel latte, since their macchiato was different than what starbucks has, so we ordered both. The latte was good and the macchiato looked good, in a tiny espresso cup, yet I didnt like its flavor so woulnt order again. Since it was her birthday, my daughters drink was free, and she loved the writing on the cup, which was just the drinks name, but very artistic.Great way to start her birthday! (they also had some delicious looking pastries!)

Love! Love! Love! Jobot is really a great place to sit down and enjoy a coffee and of course, a crepe! They have great customer service and it's a great hang out place! My friends/family and I could sit around and talk for hours!! It's really awesome. Their crepes are my favorite along with their honey vanilla latte. I highly recommend this cute hipster spot! I can never stay away!

Tried this place out based on reviews, location and well, crepes and coffee. If it sounds a little too good to be true it is because it kind of was. It is not uncommon to sometimes get weird attitude at these hipster hubs but never to the point being directly rude and feeling pushed out the door. Just a very strange experience and some mediocre crepes. Coffee was actually good but i wouldn't come back. This place was just really overrated to me.

This is going to be a simple update.
I still love the crepes so I'm keeping my rating the same. Finally tried their chai though. They make them with honey so it really changes the taste. Makes them way sweeter than spicy. Trying that once was enough. I want spicy.

The food was ok, nothing to go back for specially when I tipped the waitress that brought our food to our table and then asked us to pick up our plates after we were done and bring it to the counter so she could take it from there.  Yeah, you must order at the counter as well since the waitress won't come to your table to  take your order.  Lastly, the place is ran out of a regular house but goodness gracious get AC
Cold brew was really good. I ordered the chorizo crepe and it really didn't have that much flavor. Nothing hot sauce can't fix :)

If you live in or around Phoenix and you haven't been here...you should be punched in your face. 

Not your average breakfast; my chorizo biscuits and gravy was flat out delicious!! The creme fresh over the potatoes was a nice touch and helped cool the heat just enough. The spice is clearly there but not overwhelming. 

Don't let my score of four stars fool you, the food is out of this world. The space is a little cramped but the service was good.
Best cold brew I've ever had! Such a great little spot in the arts District - must try!
Friendly staff, relaxed place, indoor and outdoor seating. Loved the crepes and Italian sodas.

I got food poisoning from this place, the service was slow, and the staff was rude. There were about 5 other people in the place when my two friends and I stopped in. It look 30 minutes for us to get our drinks. The barista called out my friend's name and when he walked up to the counter she scolded him and yelled "that's not for you!" Maybe ask people for an initial of their last name if you have multiple people with the same name? After we drank our drinks (we each got something different) we all became violently ill soon after, I'll spare the details on that. I know we got sick from this place because that's the only thing we had in common. We didn't eat anywhere together before or after and we each went back to our own houses afterwards. I'll never come back here again. They obviously don't clean their equipment correctly or employees aren't being sanitary.

This Sunday, I decided to try the biscuits and gravy. The actual biscuits and gravy were very tasty as were the potatoes, but the eggs were a bit of a miss. One was undercooked to the point that I wondered if I should eat parts of it and the other one was slightly overlooked. I know it can be difficult to cook eggs...

But try for some more consistency.

Neat little place, very hipster vibes, friendly staff, delicious coffee/espresso

I ordered an iced agave latte, was very tasty
For breakfast I ordered one of their Nutella banana crepes, it wasn't very special just a crepe, banana and Nutella, and I feel like they skimped on the Nutella a bit, wasn't really a good ratio between crepe Nutella and banana... I'm all about ratios. I'll be back for coffee but will try another place for my crepe

I practically live here. I might end up dying here with how much mocha and curry I consume at this heavenly diner. I wish their alcoholic beverages were a bit better though. I am a cider man but they only have Schilling, which practically tastes like a very cheap beer.
My husband and I went on here on our first date I am just went back to celebrate Valentine's Day. We love the crepes!!

So glad you didn't leave us JoBot! The staff is friendly. The food is great. It's nice, relaxed friendly atmosphere where you can grab a bit or have some coffee and get a little work done. Roosevelt Row rules!

Jobot was really truly "okay". If you're in the area and you need a cup of coffee I would say that they give a good size coffee for their prices so it's not a waste of money per say. But, despite buying the largest size, the flavor left me wanting more. I ordered a vanilla latte, which I feel is a pretty good tell-tale drink: if it's good, chances are the rest of the coffee is. It's it's bad, chances are that everything else is too. My latte was not overly sweet but it was missing basically all the coffee flavor. It tasted of mostly milk with a hint
Of coffee and vanilla. I was pretty disappointed and I don't think I'd ever go back with so many amazing coffee shops in the vicinity that keep me coming back again and again like Lux Central and Lola Coffee.
Just always a great place to eat and work. The music is on point, the food is kiss-the-cook-worthy, and...did i mention that this place is open pretty much all day now?

At first I was really skeptical to see that Jobot, my beloved hidden oasis away from the gentrified hell that Phoenix has become was moving into the space. But when I super missed the coffee and the salsa and seeing all of the amazing artists and makers and movers and shakers and rebels and crazies and dreamers and nerds, I know I had to give it another chance. It's not frequently that you walk into a place and feel so invested that you find yourself busing dishes that rude people just leave laying around. I'm sure they're working on expanding the menu, and I live for the breakfast burrito that they have now. The salsa is divine and their cold brew is strong and delicious. If you want quality and community, this is the place.
We were sitting here waiting over 20 minutes just to get a beer never got serviceso we left.they served other two people that came in 10 minutes after us. Yeah I won't be going back

Tonight I had the pleasure of trying out JoBot Coffee. This trendy coffee house totally lives up to the hype for their crepes. I had the Nutella and Banana Crepe. What's not to love? It was perfect. It had just enough Nutella to give it that great hazelnut and chocolate taste. I worried that it was be caked with Nutella making it too rich to eat, but that was not the case. The bananas were great too. This was my first time at JoBot and the barista was very helpful in recommending the sweet peach tea, and the crepe. 

This place is very cool. It is an old house that was converted first into a bicycle shop and then the coffee house. One room has a living room type atmosphere, and there was ample seating outside. I will definitely go back to try the savory crepes and coffee.
Really Delicious breakfast sandwich. Only lost one star because it was quite pricey for the serving size. The takeaway pasta salad was good (not great) but very reasonably priced. Cool scene too.

Best locally owned an operated business around.  Their crepes are delicious, their staff is laid back and friendly.  They sometimes whip up brunch on the weekends and it's always delicious.  Having  a lot of food allergies, it is really awesome when servers and cooks are happy to accommodate weird/lengthy requests (no dairy/gluten).  This is the best late night/breakfast place around. 

Oh, and Brittany C... You answered to the wrong name. I was sitting next to you.  Who's fault is it when they call a name and you answer to the wrong one?  You were very rude, and totally brought down the vibe of the room.
I have been here twice. They didn't put espresso in my latte this time, and their food was gross both times... Not to mention all of the employees give off an elitist hippie/hipster vibe. Hate it.

Of course the place a few blocks away was packed. I'm so glad it was though because it lead me to look elsewhere. This place is a quiet unsuspecting diner that packs in great food, pastries, and coffee. No wait, better food, and cheap. I'll be back.

Yet another Phoenix home converted to business. It's unconventional, and I like that, but It's still a little surreal to think I'm eating in the same place some kid probably watched Saturday morning cartoons. It's okay though because the crepes were mighty tasty (the lemon in particular), and so was the coffee, despite my public verbal displays of affection towards Starbucks. If I'm in Phoenix again, I'll definitely go back.

I stoped by and order chilaquiles, it took more than 30 minutes to get my food so I decided to get up and see what was going on so they immediately brought my food , what a surprise, the tortillas were burned so I couldn't eat it , they offered me a refund which I didn't accept , I don't recommend this place !

What a nice local coffee shop! I love the atmoshphere and being able to sit outside in the nice Phoenix sunshine with Made just next door and a cute picket fence with sunflowers growing along some of the side. It's such a fresh, free environment where you can relax with a tea or coffee and read a good book, chat with friends or work on your computer. If I lived closer I would come here all the time and just sit, relax and enjoy. 

If I were a coffee drinker this place would be perfect, but I do enjoy their tea and they have some good food to choose from. I am hoping to try the crepes.
I've been to jobot a couple times and the food is good. The atmosphere is pleasant. The benches outside feel like they're going to collapse and end your life, all for a thrilling dine in experience!

Crepes - GREAT!
Coffee - Good
Chile cheese fries - Not good. Fries not crispy and only green chilies with a VERY LITTLE dust of Mexican crumbled cheese. I would rename this dish GREEN CHILE FRIES.
Chilaquiles - Not good. Their attempt on this typical Mexican breakfast item is quite sad. :(

I'm not gonna knock them for trying but will definitely only be back for the coffee and crepes.

If you want good authentic chilaquiles or other Mexican food breakfast specials, drive yourself to Central Ave. & I-17

Came here a few weeks ago with friends. Breakfast was good, tea was nice, atmosphere ok. I wasn't blown away but I also wasn't disappointed. I love the location and the interior is vintage and original. The outside was ok to have breakfast and enjoy the weather. Moderately priced.

Stopped in during a recent vacation, I was under the impression that they served food but we saw nothing other than the coffee bar.  No one said anything when we walked in, we walked around and then walked out.... I would not go there again, though there are a couple cool murals on the buildings in the area.

I have been a customer of JoBot's since before the renovations, before they had a kitchen, and before they made such amazing food. The coffee has always been genuinely and truly delicious. The food, just wow. Everything I've ever had has just been awesome. The best crepe I've ever had. True chilaquiles...not commercialized. So good. I give it 4 starts instead of 5 because of the time frame it takes to get your food--it's a small kitchen so please expect to be here for awhile for your food because it is truly worth the wait. The other reason is because I have come across 2 very snooty, nose-up-in-the-air hipster baristas while coming here who just really need to bring themselves down a notch or 5. The last barista I had was a female and was very sweet. Do NOT try The Sunrise. Orange juice and espresso--just don't. Will always stop by JoBot whenever I am downtown, no question. Oh the crepes----so good!
The ice coffee is SO good I drank it straight! Nuff said.

Ah, Jobot! How I loved your previous location, menu, and staff. Sadly you have defaulted to serving the lowest common denominator, eliminating all of your unique vegetarian options. Your coffee preparation has taken a nosedive but the cost has soared--no latte art to be found here, and the price is now $4 for an 8-ounce latte. You've broadened your beer menu and now have an extensive mixed drink list, but at the cost of forgoing the down-home atmosphere of the repurposed house you once occupied. Now the customers here come for the mimosas instead of the friendly vibe, and the staff is stretched thin so that they don't have time or desire to chat with customers like they used to. If you could bring back those awesome chilaquiles, retrain your baristas and staff, reset your prices, and try to regain the character of your prior iteration, I would return and change my review. The pros include the cleanliness of this new place and the ample seating.

I went to Jobot to get a growler filled. As they started filling my glass the keg blew and there was about an ounce and a half in the glass, which they gave me. But alas nothing left for my growler. 
They very nice about it but they can't sell you what they don't have! Seems like a nice friendly neighborhood spot, that I would visit more often if I was in the neighborhood!
Great place!!! Loved the workers, great energy!!! Food was great and not expensive. Definately a chill place for a meal.

It's an old sh!tty house in Garfield, and that's AFTER the remodel.  This place is packed with hipster kid's bikes and professionals who are on their way downtown, wanting to feel cool for drinking at the trendy coffee bar.  Coffee is nothing special and neither is their service.  Plus the art looks like it came from a 6th graders art class.

Some of the best crepes in Phoenix. And they're HUGE. I've tried some of their other food here as well and it's also dynamite. Of course the coffee itself is awesome, make sure you don't leave without trying their cold brew. Super smooth, no bitterness at all. This is the coffee shop you long for. The atmosphere is super relaxing and low key. On a day when it's not super hot I like to sit out on the patio.

I was here 7 AM on a Sunday two weeks ago.  Rudest service ever.  Despite the fact that they were hardly any customers at all, workers seemed totally disturbed by the fact they had to take a customer's order.  I ordered the strawberry-banana crepe.  When it came, the person just dropped it on my table at the coffee table and didn't bother to even look at me or say anything.  She just dropped it off liked she had better things to do, i.e. there were hardly any customers.

The two stars are for the good crepes.

This is a great local coffee shop in Downtown Phoenix. When I walk in, I immediately feel like I've walked into someone's welcoming home. There's seating at the counter and filled with friendly faces of local business people and eclectic folks sitting and conversing with each other, there are folks sitting on the patio enjoying the fresh air and there are individuals sitting and working in the open environment. It's a perfect place to sit, relax and do some work if you really must. The coffee's good, the food is delicious and offers a wide variety of items from breakfast and sandwiches to crepes and salads. I haven't tried the crepes yet but it's on my list and I promise to update my review when I do! I just wish I lived in this area so I could visit Jobot every morning!

Jobot has been a First Friday staple for me for years now, and I've always loved their creative drinks and savory crepes. When I stopped by last week though I noticed that the menu had changed, in fact, it's been downsized drastically. The coffee is still great, but the crepe options weren't the same at all, and that's what hooked me on them in the first place. Still a decent place, but a lot less exciting now with the new menu.

I love the atmosphere, the indoor and outdoor seating and the crepes are OUT OF THIS WORLD!!  I would give them a five except they don't have decaf coffee of any kind.  As someone who (for health reasons) has to have decaf, this one little thing will make or break a place for me.  I know most of the coffee-drinking world doesn't care, but for me it's the difference between four and five stars.  I even toyed with the idea of giving them three because of it, but I have to give kudos for being independent, supporting local arts, and everything else about the place is wonderful.  Luckily I live in SD so the loss of my coffee dollar is not a big deal.  : )  I will, however, get at least one crepe every time I can while I'm there!!

The coffee here is not bad. However, the service was terrible. The barista rolled her eyes at us when we ordered an extra drink and never once smiled. She didn't greet us when we came in even though we were the only people in there. She just said, what do you want?. We were going to order food but decided not to after her attitude. The art work is cool and they have a big outdoor area.

This is a great coffee shop and a great center point for the neighborhood. At first I had my reservations about the place because I loved HoodRide that occupied the building before, but after so many years, I see how this establishment has made a huge contribution to the growth of the downtown community. I love that they are open 24 hours. I have stopped here after a hearty night out (and before driving home) on more than one occasion.

This place has the very best chai that I can find in AZ, maybe even the best chai that I've ever had (outside of just about any Indian household). I respect that they make their own chai blend. You can see the bits of tea and ginger at the bottom of your cup. It is flavorful and delicious. Otherwise, the turkey, jam, and cheese crepe is my favorite (#9?), but I also order the veggie omelet and the sweet crepes from time to time.

I haven't been in for brunch in a while, but when I lived downtown, I remember them having delicious specials that are not on the regular menu on the weekends.

An interesting little surprise on a First Friday--the electric blue neon letters spelled out my beacon when searching for something to drink.  

Small businesses don't get much smaller.  Inside is about as unassuming as you can get.  The bar splits the old duplex's front room in a strictly utilitarian fashion.  Bottles of Monin flavor syrup crowd one side, a vintage ice machine near a single cash register and a small hand-drawn menu on the wall round the place out.   

The raw entrepreneurial spirit that adds to the late night fare downtown can be pretty inspiring sometimes, and I'm kicking myself for not doing it first.  I reasoned downtown didn't need another coffee shop, and I was proven wrong with a place that fills a void I didn't know existed.

What I like about this place is what's not here.  There are no knick-knacks to up-sell, nothing that beckons the over-done scenes found at coffeehouses elsewhere.  There's nothing to take away from a kickass cup of coffee when you want it except what appeared to be a delightful-looking waffle-cone carried out of the back.  

The place was *swamped* on First Friday, but despite the rush it never once felt claustrophobic.  The line shuffled quickly, and my drink was made lickety split, faster than other coffee shops that have a fraction of the crowd.  It arrived so fast, I actually didn't believe it was mine, especially when it seemed the barista was new.  A good sign for his future there.  

The cashier was friendly and we welcomed each other to the neighborhood.  She made sure I got my 10th JoBot Free card.  

But you know what the best part was?   I casually noted the price of the large $4 latte.  I can't drink cow's milk, so I get soy.  And coffee is just boring without a flavor shot.  

Anywhere else I go, that "$4" drink is at least $6.  At JoBot, it was still $4.  

When she told me that, I had been repeatedly counting my dollar bills, pondering the final damage of my add-ons.  Needless to say, I didn't believe her.  

Practically everything has its catch, its obnoxious little down-side.  

Except JoBot.  Thank you Mr. Sagasta.

10/10.

I love trying out local eateries, and am always hopeful that I can give a local place rave reviews. Unfortunately, I can't really rave about Jobot. 

The first time I went I had a crepe with ricotta cheese, homemade jam, and powdered sugar. The crepe was fantastic! If this review was based solely on that, I'd give it 5 stars. It was perfectly balanced, not too sweet, the crepe itself was neither too thick nor too thin, and the portion was perfect. To drink, I ordered a raspberry Italian creme soda. I've had better. The balance of syrup to soda water was off, and all the syrup managed to do was make it slightly pink. Generally, I expect my Italian sodas to be a little sweet. Not sticky sweet, but sweet enough. This really wasn't sweet at all. So that kind of sucked.

The second time I was there, I brought a friend. Instead of going for a crepe, I decided to try a sandwich. I got the Jo-Banh Mi, and my friend got the Torta. Both the pork on my sandwich and on hers was good. The sauces were flavourful, and both had a little bit of a kick. I wish my banh-mi had come on a crustier bread, since it got a wee bit soggy pretty quick. I ended up ditching the bread and just eating the pork with a fork. I ordered another raspberry creme soda, and asked them to make it extra sweet. Yeah, it wasn't. Still just pink soda water. Kind of disappointing. 

So basically, the food was good. Based on my experiences, I'd recommend the crepes over anything else. However, I knocked off a couple stars for the service and the atmosphere. The gentleman who took my order the first time, was helpful for disinterested. Was more interested in chatting up the girls at the counter. The woman who took my order the second time was pretty checked out. She mentioned she'd worked there for two years, and just seemed bored. There was no communication from the people who brought the food out. But after watching for a little bit, I'm thinking it was just me. Anyone who came in that appeared to be either a) college age, b) a "hot chick", or c) a hipster, everyone was super attentive. 

I am none of those things. 

Not only were the employees more attentive to those types of individuals, but I was getting all sorts of side-eyed looks from many of those individuals. Maybe if I had had a beard and a man bun, things would have been different.

This place is pretty legit. I had the crepes and they were pretty awesome. I'm the kind of person that loves personal touch on a place, without getting too carried away. It's a bit small inside but there's plenty of seating outside. The special last Sunday was a some kind of mexican dish that he probably won't make again but is was really freaking good and the prices are very reasonable.
Pretty cool coffee shop downtown. Open late and serves food late. Great Service. Highly recommend.

Well done! My girl and I were out taking a walk this morning...when she said "lets get breakfast here"...a place that she visits when she is up late studying. Admittedly I am about the furthest thing from what I'd picture the average guest here looks like...and from what I viewed walking in this morning...I would be fairly accurate. I was highly overdressed with my collared golf shirt and Old Navy jeans....but thankfully no one held that against me :p
My love had scrambled eggs with jalapenos/ cheese/chorizo and loved it. I had pecan apple bacon crepes...which were also excellent. We both liked the coffee...not to strong or SBucks bitter Most of these "artsy" places charge you mega money for tiny portions, essentially having you pay for the "experience" of being there...in which case I end up hitting up Mickey D's for a egg mcmuffin or two after I dine at such places just to fill me up, this was not the case here...fair price as well as portion size.....I am impressed....wow...whats happening to me..my GF made me drive her Prius, and now I have been seen on Roosevelt Row eating at a hippie joint...Glenn Beck....save my soul! :) Cant wait to go back and try something different!
Had coffee here was a nice place  Parking can be a bit of a pain but it's downtown .People that  work there are very friendly . Nice feel to the place .
Place is great. Always open food is delicious and coffee is fresh. The jo bot breakfast sandwich is the biz

I miss their old location. I like how they added a bar which adds "cool" points. I like how it is open late. The ambiance is nice and relaxing but if you want to study, go to the library because it can get loud. I just come here for their crepes and maybe their coffee.

The most AWESOMEST thing is it's open 24 hours during the weekends. This was quite handy since I had to find something not fast food nearby at 6am on a Saturday.

#9 SAVORY ($8)
- applewood smoked bacon & garlic herb turkey breast, jobot mixed berry compote topped with an over easy egg and powdered sugar
- PERFECT blend of savory and sweet!
- the turkey wasn't dry and quite flavorful
- enjoyed every single bit of it.
- wish I could find something like this in Los Angeles.

CAPPUCCINO ($3)
- solid with good coffee flavor
- compliments the crepe very well

SERVICE: staff was very friendly even if it was 6am in the morning. They steered me in the right direction as to what to order since the menu is so extensive! Food was made to order and served at just the right temperature.

ENVIRONMENT: very quaint setting on the corner of Roosevelt and 5th St. It actually looks like a house from the outside. There is a large outdoor seating area which is awesome for when the weather doesn't get too hot. The inside seating is more like a homey coffee shop feel. There are actually seats at the coffee bar. Some may even say it has a hipster vibe.

Overall, great place to check out in the Arts District of Phoenix. May not have the same vibe as Lux and definitely not as expensive. Parking may be difficult as it's a residential area. I would definitely recommend it to others!

Excellent coffee. Very rich, deep flavor. I dig the atmosphere of this place. Ya know, the whole 'house turned coffee shop' vibe. There are tables outside on the front lawn and patio, tables scattered throughout the house and a bar in the front room. It gives the place a very comforting mood. Like going over a kooky Aunt's house.

The only thing I was sketched out by was, if you look into the back room next to the bar there's a shelf covered with electrical chords plugged in and going every which way. It looks absolutely crazy, like an electrical fire waiting to happen. Makes me wonder what other crazy shit is going on back there. 

Other than the imminent death, the coffee was great and the scone I had was tasty. I'd definitely return.

Everyone had been recommending Jobot to me since I came to downtown Phoenix for school, but it's been three years, and only now have I tried it out. Needless to say, my friends were all correct: Jobot is one of the best coffee shops. The space is pretty industrial but still welcoming, and the menu has variety but also plenty of staples. I tried out a chorizo crepe and was pretty happy with it, although the chorizo was spicer than I expected. I also like the option of having patio seating because sometimes they music is a little too loud indoors, making it difficult to have conversations, though I wouldn't mind it for studying. Overall, I'd say its pretty ideal for doing work or hanging out, and I'll have to come back before I leave downtown Phoenix!

I love this place for food, coffee, or studying. While it has gotten less quaint and much busier over the years I still love to cuddle up with a book or my laptop for a Sunday morning study session. Their staff is, well, not unfriendly but they are a little more on the serious side, I suppose. But hey, if I wanted to be verbally molested and OVERLY engaged by my barista, I would go to Dutch Bros. Amirite? 

Overall, great food, great atmosphere, and leave the baristas alone, they are busy!!!!

Loved this place, especially their weekend hours! We came right before midnight after some bar hopping and needing a late night snack. This place seems like it is in a residential neighborhood but was very welcoming with a cool vibe. 

There was a great selection of sweet and savory crepes - we went with one stuffed with ricotta and topped with chocolate and almonds, as well as one stuffed with peanut butter and chocolate. They were both so soft, delicious and satisfying! We took them down with some fresh coffee to cap off a great evening!

I am so sad to have to give this place two stars, because it is really only because of one person. I live very close by and frequent the shops around this place a lot. I came here one morning with my boyfriend and he got the hungry man and I had a yogurt. The food was wonderful; we sat outside and had a really nice breakfast together. Needless to say if this was my only experience with them they would have 5 stars, but unfortunately it was not. 

I ordered food TOGO on a Sunday morning, which I am not naive to the fact that places are busy on Sunday morning especially around the time that I ordered.
