I spoke to a gentleman on the phone who took my order and confirmed my wait time to be between 15 to 20 minutes. I arrived around 20 minutes later to pay for my food. While in line I could not notice the way the barista was speaking to some of the customers. I get that this is a new day and people are allowed to have opinions and market themselves however these seem fit, however I would hope this coffee shop doesn't not want to be represented they way this woman carried herself. I paid for my TOGO and she did not say one word to me, like "let me check on that" or "let me see how much longer." But hey, it was a Sunday morning like I said before so maybe she was so busy she did not have the time to give a thought to my order. Fine. I'll let that slide. I stood in that coffee shop for another 30 minutes before I finally said something to her, and asked her about my food. She responded that they had a lot of TO GO orders and my was being boxed up next. Fine, again I just wanted my food. Another 15 minutes goes by and more food comes out of that window, none of which are mine. So again I asked her, "so, clearly mine was not the next to get boxed, could you check to see how much longer? I just don't want to be lied to about my food order." She gave me the worst attitude ever because I must have inconvenienced her that my food was not out yet after I have waited by this time an hour for my breakfast. The real person that should be upset was me. Although her nasty attitude and belittling comments really took a turn when she felt the need to bring me my food and as I walked up to her she walked right past me as if that food wasn't mine, went to the little bar they have in there to get me a spoon turned around to then give me my food. An immature game played by a women that needed to make herself feel better on what must have been a tough day for her. I hope that your future is filled with better days so she can have a better attitude towards life.

Had to update as the experience of stopping in can change when you have a toddler along. My daughter LOVED her food, danced to the music, had a great time. Our food and drinks were wonderful, JoBot is totally child friendly, and too me that makes a huge difference! Can't love a place anymore than that! I really love this place!

Really not impressed, went in and tried a dirty chai latte and got what tasted like dirty coffee water. The aesthetic was appealing, but staff didn't seem attentive and a bit ditzy. This is right across the street from where I live so I really hoped for better.
Enter this place for a telecommute to some hip european city. Everything is great about this place, you'll always find a surprise. Try everything there.

My pal Dayvid recommended I check this place. DANG IT.

That weird crepe with turkey breast, bacon, swiss cheese, fruit compote, powdered sugar AND a egg on top is haunting me.

Nowhere in Los Angeles has something similar. Now I have to figure out how to make this.

Good coffee, good vibes, keep on :)

Came here about an hour and a half before closing with a couple of friends after work. I expected it to be warmer inside since it had recently rained and was freezing outside but no it was still chilly. I ordered my favorite, a jelly turkey melt while my friends took my suggestions on dishes I've had before and ordered some chile fries and a chicken quesodilla. we all ordered iced chai's which tasted okay (we agreed that  we've had better elsewhere) Food was good and we all shared a strawberry Nutella crepe which we thought was delicious. Only.thing that bugged me was the cold and the fact that it was alot quieter than usual (music wise). We still enjoyed ourselves and will definitely be coming back

Since my very first journey into the bosom of JoBot over a decade ago, much has changed.

They added more delicious food options, traded their cash register for an iPad and opened up the indoor dining space. I must say that I do miss the cozy, homey vibe that came with nestling into the labyrinth-like wooden dining space but I'm happy to see them growing

These crepes are the best! My favorite has fresh spinach, basil, black bean, sun dried tomatoes and the PESTO! I could write an ode to their pesto. It has me dreaming about it, salivating and fantasizing about it...really.

Good coffee, amazing food, cool chill space indoors and out. I also hear they are getting their liquor license - can't wait!

The cold brew iced coffee was amazing, I would definately get it again. The food/sandwich I had here was well worth the money, $14 for everything. I was actually skeptical at first because of the questionable ingredients together in the turkey-jelly something sandwich I got but it was recommended by the barista and turned out surprisingly good & my friend loves the crepes. The music was chill (weezer & brand new). My only thing was the neighborhood was kinda shabby (the businesses here are run out of houses in a residential neighborhood) but I guess thats the scene in this general vicinity! Also very interesting art on the walls...
Delish!!! Offers something for everyone. Friendly, hip and unique! Everything I expected from a downtown Phoenix eatery. Chorizo crepe is outstanding!!!!

JoBot is a hipster coffee joint in the Roosevelt Row. It's hard to distinguish whether these historical house-like buildings are actual residences or business establishments... but I guess that ambiguity adds to the character of this place. 

Friend and I went to eat a light breakfast before our flight. I ordered a house coffee (bottomless) and the JoMama's Breakfast sandwich (good, but the mustard was a bit sweet). Definitely has a homemade feel to its food. Time of prep was close to 10-15 minutes, so not quite a "grab and go" kind of spot. Seems to be a nice study cafe for hispters and college students alike.
I thought you couldn't get better than these crepes, but Jobot's potatoes topped with cream and Pico may be the best thing in the wintery valley of the sun!
I ordered a Latte from here and it was the worse tasting coffee I've EVER had. The service was atrocious and would NOT recommend this place to anyone.

So freaking good. The vibe here is really chill. The food is crazy good. I love the breakfast burrito with black beans instead of chorizo (simply because I don't eat meat) but I've heard that people love the chorizo. The coffee is on point here as well!

Went to grab a late night cup of coffee at this 24-7 spot.  The coffee is great but the service was bitchy. She really thought her coffee grounds didn't stink and seemed annoyed at our arrival. The place was thrown together in a quant old bungalow style home which has character,  but ultimately lacked class in the staff,  which is what would make a difference.  Next time I'll go somewhere else because service is half of it!

My opinion has definitely shifted since they relocated. I was a regular at the 5th St. location, and I ended up there on most days after school when I was in high school. Although the relocation and all the other changes may be sad, JoBot seems to be thriving in a much more positive way than they were before. The coffee is always good, the food is a bit more expensive for my taste, but still really good always. :)

My wife really wanted to try this place out, and I love crepes, so why not.
Got iced chai, it had a really weird taste, like too much luke warm milk and the spices didn't mix well and just sat at the bottom, I took it back and just got a water, which was pretty warm actually, then I had the banana, nutella crepe, this was close to being nasty, it had the black bean flavor in it from my wifes crepe, that they cooked first and served 5 minutes before I got mine, and I'm still not sure what they used for it, I think it was flour tortilla my wife didn't think so.
I give it 2 stars because my wife liked her bean crepe and ice coffee.

They couldn't even serve me cold water, their not getting my business again.

Went here with a group of folks for brunch.  We took advantage of spring in February and took over a couple of picnic tables in the front yard. Really nice relaxing atmosphere. Service was friendly, even after I spilled some of my coffee on myself and the floor. :)  I had a jelly turkey melt that had Jalapeno bacon jam in it. It was great. I did not hear a single complaint about anything that anybody else had either. I know modern day coffee shops are all about the different coffee based drinks but their base drip coffee is pretty good black.

I really like the banana Nutella crepes, and coffee. My husband wasn't impressed at all, by the food or the service. I sat inside but they have a decent patio with a Phoenix gentrification-in-progress ambience. 
I've been three times now and the service has been consistently poor. Even as the first customer of the day with no one else in the place we couldn't get a coffee refill. 
You can bring your dog, sit on the patio, and have a nice breakfast, but probably only one cup of coffee. 
I'd give it 3.5 stars if I could. Just not quite 4.

Holy Crepes! 
Iced Mocha - More like iced "crack" mocha...I'm bouncing off the walls. Si Si me gusta~
Banana-Nutella Crepe - Sweet Virgin Mary silhouette on my morning toast, It was heavenly!
...AND a punch card?! I'll be a doughy mess in no time. Thanks yo!

Open 24 hours through the weekend, until midnight otherwise. Downtown is starting to have a life.

Early 20th Century bungalow, as all these funky businesses on this block. Across the street tonight was an excellent jazz guitarist plucking away, alone, lost in his music, in a front yard ...

The savory and sweet crepes just keep getting better, and I finally made it last Sunday to the brunch - the best light pancakes I've tasted in years served with real maple syrup and exquisite Schreiner's sausage. Nibbled over two hours of unending visits and great  Beirut-style cafe banter from downtown's notables.

Life is good.
Very hipsterish! Don't you dare ask for decaf or an artificial sweetner!

I really want to write a 5 star review for this cool, funky, full of "love" downtown establishment but being the Yelper that I am, several factors prevent me from doing so. 
The first & foremost is the choice of music that the DJ played on the chosen Sunday afternoon when my son & I were there. 
It was a beautiful afternoon, perfect weather as Phoenix can be in January. Glorious, in fact.  My son (who is 8) and I had just finished volunteering at a nearby community garden, was starving and walked over here around 1pm to have lunch. 
There was loud music playing, the patio was filled with diners, everything was picture perfect. 
Then I asked my son if he wanted to sit outside or inside. He chose inside which was odd since the weather was so nice out. So we sat inside for a bit then I convinced him to go outside which he begrudgingly did. He kept fidgeting on the bench- finally I asked him what was wrong and he blurts out- "Mom, are you listening to the words to the music???  It's sh*t this, *uck that and I'm going to kill this person or that person." 
My mouth immediately formed an "o" because I had not been listening to the words as I had processed the music into background noise. 
Of course we moved back inside right away where the choice of music was much more suitable for all ages & genders. 
Pretty poor choice by the DJ I would say and pretty poor selection by the management for picking aforementioned DJ!
The other issue I had was I had ordered the crepe w pulled pork shoulders. When the dish came, the pork was not pulled but sliced. It was also very dry- served without any sort of sauce. And the red cabbage/ cilantro salad so beautifully described on the menu was just some chopped up red cabbage. 
The server was very nice and brought me extra salsa & extra lime/cilantro dressing to make the dish taste less dry. It was still a disappointment. 
My son was also disappointed with his cheese/chicken quesadilla saying there was not enough cheese (truth- it was very skimpy) and some slices had cheese and chicken while others barely had any fillings. It was uneven. 
I would come back here again. I do love the vibe and would give this place another chance!

Great food, drinks, and atmosphere. The staff is always friendly. I usually use it to study late into the night. Super bummed that they'll be closing this location  Hopefully they're able to find a new space that's just as good, if not better.

I appreciate that the chai is real tea and not made from some syrup or concentrate, but the couple times I've gotten it, it hasn't been mixed to my liking. With JoBot the honey and spices seem to to always just sit sadly at the bottom of my cup.

My friend and I have recently made a point to try out a new coffee shop once a week in the Phoenix area. We came here on a recommendation of a friend who said the food was delicious. We had no problem getting parking right out front around 10:30 on a Friday. There was no wait at the counter and I ordered a medium latte (4$), a side of eggs ($2), and a chive bacon cheddar cheese biscuit ($3). I was going to order a small but the barista pointed out that their small was particularly small and I chose to size up (thank you!). 

My friend and I sat out on the patio and eyed the crepe the people next to us ordered. I will be sure to order one next time I'm here. The eggs came out quickly and were well seasoned and fluffy. The latte was equally fantastic! We enjoyed taking in the neighborhood scenery and over all it was a very relaxed and calm atmosphere. 

Overall it was a great spot to hang out and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Nothing I would change.

Awesome place. Great food and great drinks. Honestly sometimes the service can suck but for the most part they provide good service and food.  Get the jorito. The salsa is the fucking best. Also love the pancakes.

Highly recommend this hippie coffee house .... The food and coffee is amazing ... Started off with a homemade donut filled with Nutella .... A M A Z I N G!!
Then had a grilled cheese sandwich with chicken flavored with chorizo .... With roasted potatoes .... Grilled and seasoned perfectly ..... If you are a red state voter you may not care for the clientele and stickers ...

Don't believe the menu on their website; their actual, in store menu is completely different & does not contain any Vegan options.  I don't recommend this place and cannot condone their bait & switch tactics.

Went here for brunch one beautiful Sunday around 1030am. Jobot is easy to find, next to our favorite gem of a bar, Lost Leaf.  The restaurant is quite small as it is a converted bungalow, which in my opinion adds to the charm of the place.  We were greeted and welcomed in immediately.  There was probably room for about 25 or so people seated inside and at the bar, and then another 30 outside on their patio which was already filled with people.  

I ordered the jo-rrito & a chai and my husband ordered the country breakfast and a coffee.  The woman told us to expect a little wait because they were just starting to get busy, which we totally understand and have no issue waiting. We took our seat with our drinks and I'm glad we got there when we did, because there was a sudden line out the door!  You wouldn't be able to sit at the bar during this time as the line stretches past the seats, hugging them, so there would be no room at all to get in and sit at the bar comfortably.

We probably waited about 20 minutes for our food which was brought out to use. I was pleased that the jo-rrito was not the size of a football like most breakfast burritos are. It was normal sized! yay! I might be able to finish this... and I did.  Husband loved his country breakfast which was layered with a bean paste that was quite tasty.  Everything was delicious and hit the right spot. All in all, we enjoyed this place and give it a healthy 4 stars.

The coffee and food are amazing. Seriously, I've worked throughout Latin America and I've been to so many coffee shops. This is the best coffee and even better cold brew in the world. 

Why don't you rate it 5 Stars? It's with a heavy heart that I can't go to Jobot anymore. I used to go to work on homework and it was an amazing place. BUT the internet is unreliable. I can't figure out how to "trigger" the prompt to enter the password. Probably because I've been there so much and my computer knows the password. I don't know what the issue is and whenever I ask for help from the workers, they can't help me either. I'm in law school and I need access to the internet to get my work done. There were too many incidents when I ordered a meal and coffee only to realize that I couldn't connect to the internet when I sat down. This is an amazing environment for me to do my homework and I really wish I could make it work. 

This place is amazing. Whenever I don't need the internet, I'll come back. But unfortunately, that won't be often.

Great coffee and food.

A very lay back environment, I wasn't to fond of the customer service aspect, that is the only reason I didn't give JoBot five stars.

I love heading downtown - we stopped on a Sunday morning and it wasn't packed like other breakfast joints. You walk up to the counter and order - at first I was a little confused because the setup seemed a little off. You wait in line right next to the counter with seats. So I guess you can order at the bar?  No, the register? Yes, the register!

We ordered the chorizo, mozzarella, cheese and spinach scramble and the warm peanut butter crepes. Both were delicious!! There weren't very many tables so we opted for a two person table right next to the bathroom. Just the way the seats are set up and how you can see the bathroom every time someone walks in and out of it while I eat is a little disturbing. Now I know why some restaurants have a wall between the bathroom and your dining area. 

I could have seated outside but it was a tad bit hot. There was a dj and I was totally getting into the music. I ordered an iced vanilla latte with almond milk and it was ok. I wouldn't come back for the coffee, but I would come back for the food.

I have been to JoBot a few times and have always just gotten coffee, which has been good (not mind-blowing, just average). Today I was with a friend and we were in the area, so we stopped by JoBot for lunch. We both got the Jo-Banh Mi and...it was absolutely disgusting! Plus, it was not a Banh Mi. It was spicy, pulled pork with shredded carrots on a french roll. No pickled vegetables, no cilantro, no baguette, and smothered in sauce! 

If you have never had a real Banh Mi, then you may think that this is the real thing, but it's not. I really hope the owners of JoBot read this review and either change how they make their Bahn Mi or change the name of the sandwich because, what they served me, was a misleading, disgusting slop of Americanized garbage!

I swung by this joint during the summer, and I will forewarn everybody that they only have an evaporative cooler and some fans, which I don't mind, however when I'm trying to study or do some work in my computer, haha. My husband had to do some hw and all of the outlets were taken. It's pretty hipster, rustic, kind of neat, but too hot for the summer, especially when you're trying to get work done. We pretty much just ordered some regular coffees sat down for a good 30 minutes then left because it was a little too humid and hot for us to do our work. We ended up going next door to melt, which was awesome! (Going to write a review for them). The coffees were good, we would like to visit again and try out the crepes sometime, and stay longer too of course! So I will post an update review in the near future!
Small but warm and welcoming. You feel welcomed as soon as you walk in. Awesome coffee and great food. Reasonably priced as well. I'll definitely come back.
The crepes at JoBot are fucking awesome, as is pretty much everything else. This place is where dreams come true.
We only had mochas, but let me tell you, they were the best I've ever had in my life. Excellent place! It has a fun atmosphere and great music too.
I like Kharli. She is my favorite because she is the prettiest person at jobot. Also she makes good drinks.

Ummm, ya, crunchy...groovy? Unexpected, unapologetic; it does what it wants and does it well. A random coffee house that also serves fun crepes. In the mood for something different, but worthy? Set GPS to "JoBot Coffee".

I would love to be writing a review right now of JoBot's delicious coffee and scones... but, alas, I cannot because the snob of a barista refused to even acknowledge our presence let alone actually offer to serve us a coffee.  We stumbled upon JoBot on a random Saturday driving through downtown and thought we would stop in for a drink.  There were four or five other people in the place and we took a seat up at the bar.  The barista was in the process of taking another person's order and everyone else appeared to have been served already.  We had no problems waiting while he wrapped up.  Ten minutes later... and he still hasn't said a peep to us, hasn't even made eye contact actually.  The thrill of supporting a local business waned and we eventually (13 min after arriving) got up and left.  It truly felt as though we didn't fit their desired clientele and therefore they didn't want to be bothered with us polluting their hip aesthetic.  Give me Starbucks' friendly baristas over that crap any day.

This place has great food. I love the environment. It's hip and trendy. I love that it's open 24/7 on the weekends. That means I could get crepes at like 2 in the morning. I ordered the number 9 crepe which has chicken, bacon, and a delicious compote. It's definitely savory and filling. The price is also not too bad. It's great for the food quality you're getting. We ordered 2 drinks, 3 crepes, and a bowl of french fries for about 30 dollars. Not too shabby. Will come again and again when I'm in the area. Too bad there's not one by my house because I would have come every single day!
Everyone loves jobot! Great community place to go, fun, and delicious food. Love the expansions.
Cool lil spot. Really dope vegan option if you get the lentil sammy on a different bread. Love the outdoor seating.

I have been here twice now on the weekend for late night coffee and dessert. They have all the normal coffee drinks, scones, cookies, and lots of crepes( sweet & savory ). 

I have had the cinnamon & sugar crepe and the lemon and powdered sugar one. Both crepes were cooked perfectly, they could have used a little more of the flavoring in the crepes, but overall they were good. My italian creme soda they made me really hit the spot ( i am not a coffee drinker). My husband really enjoyed his iced toddy and their other hot coffees. 

Service was  great and this place is open 24 hours on Friday & Saturday nights...go check them out.

Great hole in the wall, good old school music and great value! $6 for sweet crepes and $7 for savory. 

I ordered the rancher and soy iced latte. Loved them both!
Hip place for coffee and craft beer. Has a nice outdoor patio with electrical outlets and open WiFi.

What an amazing place! From the moment you pull up, the vibe at JoBot is unlike any other coffee shop I've been to in Phoenix (or ever, for that matter!). Located in the heart of Roosevelt Row, this lovely place fits right in to the culture and ambience of its surroundings.

With a huge outdoor front patio, JoBot is a perfect place to hang with friends, get work done, or just enjoy their great coffee on the front porch. Averaged priced, you'll get more value from one cup of coffee here than your Starbucks. Plus, you'll be supporting local businesses!

Get to JoBot at least once while you're in Phoenix.

i'm not sure why i haven't written a review for jobot yet- i'm there at least once a week and it has become my go to coffee shop. their toddy is the best i've had in phoenix- it's well made and a good price. the crepes are good as well- i usually get either a #2 or a #3 with an egg. i've really never had issue with the service- i'm not expecting my barista and i to be bffs. the fact that they are open late sun-thurs and 24 hours on fri and sat is a plus and so is the wifi. it's a cool spot and the crowd is way less pretentious than lux or cartel.  have only one complaint- the piano in the back room has been a source of annoyance for months now. i know it's not always being used but when it is, it makes me question whether to move onto songbird or lola...
I'll give 4 stars, credit to the great folks and amazing Latte. The food is good too, not special, but worth a praise. I will go back soon.

I really enjoy the hipster vibe and unique crepe based menu. I frequent this spot for study/blogging sessions. I do think they need to give this place a little more TLC though and work on establishing better Wifi connection. I had to leave last time because both my boyfriend and I couldn't get internet connection. 

Still a great local spot!

Terrible service at the bar. Sat down at the bar and no one even looked in my direction. I had to get up and order my beer from a pretty boring selection. The whole time I drank my beer no one came over to see how I was doing or ask if I wanted another drink. I'm here on a work trip. Usually you can sit at a bar when its not crowded and ask the bartender suggestions for places to go. Not here

I ordered a cappuccino here.  It was fine, flavorful, with a creamy crema; quite soft, and smooth but with a nice weight to it, like a curvy girl.  The cappuccino was sized nicely right.  Open atmosphere inside and out, people hanging about doing whatnots.

This isn't solely a coffee shop. If you're looking for high quality coffee and service I recommend going elsewhere. This is half restaurant/diner with one corner dedicated to coffee. The vibe isn't exactly welcoming and the coffee shop line forms right in the middle of their walk way inside. You stand right next to their kitchen where orders come out. It's loud in here, very crowded and like I said before, NOT A COFFEE SHOP. Looked like a cool spot to grab drinks! It is in downtown Phoenix though so be prepared for downtown Phoenix. My drink was OK but I would not go back. I didn't finish even half of it.

Jobot is a lovely establishment, I highly recommend it. Everyone that I have brought here has really loved it, and I think liked me more because of my good taste :) 

Food/Drink: One gripe I have with a lot of coffee shops is how pretentious they are. The overwhelming variety of options makes me feel like a chump and not worthy. Jobot, on the other hand, has enough variety and sufficient quality to appease my friends with more distinguished palates, but makes me feel comfortable (this could also be due to their service which I will expound on more below). I always get the cold brew, and I personally find it delicious. Plus, the coffee is locally sourced, which always makes me feel better. As far as the noms go, I've only tried a pastry. I remember thinking it was good, but also can't remember what it was, so it clearly wasn't that memorable. 

Atmosphere: Jobot's atmosphere is what sets it apart. It's quiet, but not oppressively so. I've done work on my laptop in a corner before, and have also brought friends and family here to chat and play board games. Both times, I felt at ease. There is also an outdoor patio which is nice when it's cooler out, and is also dog-friendly. I've brought my own board games to play, but have also played using their small arsenal-- I think all they have is Scrabble, chess, and dominoes, but I could be wrong.

Service: The people who work at Jobot are super nice, and that may also be what contributes to my good impression of the atmosphere. They are patient and helpful. I came once with a friend who can be demanding and rude at times, and the staff dealt with the situation very calmly and professionally. They also keep the place spick and span.

Parking: Even though it's downtown, there's a covered parking lot right next to it that usually has one or two spaces for non-residents. There's a two-hour max for parking, which is not ideal, but they don't enforce this too strictly in my experience. Plus, the area around is nice enough to walk around a bit from wherever you parked.

Good things: soy chai latte (honestly the best I've ever had, anywhere), artsy environment, outdoor seating is plentiful.

Bad things: limited parking, and the crepes aren't very crepe-y. They're more like tortillas trying really really hard to be French.

Overrated and overpriced - we tried to go last week and it was jam-packed. Not sure why. The toddy was good but we had to wait to get the attention of the "barista" to get some cream and my friend had to wait after others behind us had been served to get her coffee. The half a breakfast sandwich at $5 was not worth that much but the $3.50 lemon crepe was good. It was ok but not somewhere I'd go out of my way for again.

I do love this place. The food and the ambiance is eclectic, unique, and fun. I love the live music and choice of drinks and food. I got the chilaquiles and classic crepe. My boyfriend got the sweet potato biscuit and gravy dish. Our food was SO good. I couldn't give the place 5 stars because there wasn't enough seating for the volume they did, we were cramped on the side of some people by the window. Also our food took about 30 minutes, probably a little more. Not terrible but it was long enough for us to notice, and we're definitely not impatient people. I still would've gave the place 4 stars, but our food was kind of cold, I ordered an egg for my chilaquiles, it never came out. So I politely asked the cashier who rang us up if I could get it, still never came out. Usually I wouldn't care so much about it, but I had already paid extra for the egg that I never got. 

I still recommend this place. Our experience was probably not the best due to it being a very busy Sunday afternoon, but not being able to find a seat, food taking very long, and never receiving something I paid for made me bring it down 2 stars. But the coffee is outstanding, food is great, and energy is also great. I hate giving bad reviews but I really do like this place and hope someone sees it and maybe want to make a little improvement.

Positives: open late, free wi-fi, free entomology lessons (if that's your thing...read on)

Negatives: everything else

OK WOW!  I have been meaning to write my first review for a while now, but I was basically forced to do it right now by my experience at Jobot.  Too bad my first review has to be a negative one, but I feel I owe it to all of you who so faithfully warn me to stay away from places like this, although you may have let me down on this one!

So I read through most of the reviews and felt that I had a fairy good idea of what to expect.  Since many reviews seemed positive enough, I thought I'd give it a try since I am getting bored with the same old coffee joint.  So I found my way from the dark street in front of Jobot, through the dimly lit patio area, up onto the old wooden porch, to the front door, and into Jobot ready to fall in love with the place.  

As I entered I was initially overwhelmed by three things.  One: the blaring punk music, two: the swamp cooler blasting air and noise directly at my head, and three: the total apathy of the staff who were conversing among themselves (ironically, about how "dead" it's been) while ignoring me.  I was eventually approached by a worker and I placed my order ($2.75 for an 8oz skim latte...more about the latte later).  

While waiting for my latte, I decided to have a look at the pastry selection at the end of the coffee bar; only problem was, there were 3 employees standing there talking and blocking access to the pastry case.  I politely said "excuse me" as I tried to squeeze by them.  I kid you not...they glanced at me and then continued talking.  I squeezed thru the gaggle of employees determined to get a look at the pastries.  Once through the gauntlet of employees, I had a look at the pastries, which looked a little "run thru the mill" if you know what I mean.

OK so determined to make the best of this experience, I pressed on.  While continuing to wait for my latte I poked my head into the two adjacent rooms.  The rooms are dingy and uninviting with hard, uncomfortable wooden benches and cheap metal frame stacking style chairs scattered about.  The crowd inside (two customers) was interesting.  One guy covered head to toe in tattoos hunched over an old laptop, and an older man snoozing in the corner near his empty coffee cup and book.  

...so back to waiting for my latte.  I intended to pay for it when I was intercepted by a 2 inch long cockroach crossing the floor between me and my latte.  I politely waited for it to pass.  While waiting for the roach to pass, I glanced at the guy who seemed to be in charge of the place to see how he would handle this most interesting situation.  He looked at me, shrugged his shoulders as if to say "whatcha gonna do"?  I almost laughed at the absurdity of it all, but quickly remembered I was on the hook to pony up the currency for my latte, which I did, albeit reluctantly at this point. 

I have taken my seat, opened my laptop, and am writing this review as we speak.  A few more shady characters have popped in and out, although they don't seem to be customers since they didn't buy any food or drink.  I assume they are friends with the owner(s).  

My stomach has turned sour from the experience with the roach and having to recount the ordeal in detail as I write this review... so my latte will sit untouched as I leave in about 1 minute from now.  

I hope you have enjoyed my contribution.  Thanks for sharing all of yours!

Jobot is amazing. I got an iced vanilla latte and the Nutella & banana crepe this morning. Both the coffee and the crepe were fantastic. I liked the big outdoor front patio. The interior of the shop isn't huge so that added the additional seating that was needed. I plan on going out of my way to go to Jobot for coffee before work this week because it was so good. I 100% recommend it.
Cute little place.  I always get the chai tea latte and it never disappoints.  Refreshing alternative to the coffee chains. Place is pretty small so it can be at times hard to find a place to sit.

Can't speak to the food, but the coffees here are splendid. I always order Americanos or cold brew when I go to coffee shops to see how good their coffee REALLY is, and Jobot has some killer beans. Worth a stop if you're in the area!
Love this place.  The chopped salad is delicious,  and the crepes....oooh the crepes,  yum! Great vibe,  with a nice outdoor seating area as well as window counter.
Yum yum, I love me some rootbeer pork crepe with my mocha latte late night. This place is cool! Old house into hip coffee shop.
Love love love! Best iced tea selection ever!  I tried the peanut butter and jelly donut and it was fluffy and delightful. Staff is always quick and friendly. Def a great place to take a stroll to.

24 HOUR CREPES ON THE WEEKENDS! The lemon! The powdered sugar! The hipster organic coffee and toddys!!

This is everything I want out of a coffee shop. Love you guys. A little condescending at times, and the female baristas don't seem to care much about anything, but to all the dudes working here, keep it up!
I love crepe and tea. Next time I will try donut. The outdoor table is nice to be there and absorbing Roosevelt row neighborhood.
Amazing food. We landed in Phoenix and the first thing we found was JoBot Coffee and did we really find a gem. My sandwich was great while the other crepes we ordered were great too.

Loved the music here -- they were playing an Odesza playlist when I was here. What a lovely place to hang out and sip coffee. I sat inside because it was hot out, but there's a nice patio with tables and chairs outdoors too.

Coffee is still good, but their menu isn't good anymore :(. No more of their fried potatoes and very limited in the crepe options; the environment isn't the same either.  Wish is felt more welcoming- music is too loud and it's hard to have a conversation.

JoBot used to be my friends and I's "spot" 3 almost 4 years ago. We went here to get coffee, grab savory or dessert crepes and just hangout. Sadly, this place started going downhill beginning of this year. The server wasn't as entertaining or nice as the previous ladies who worked here before, their menu changed completely, and the food as unfortunately in my opinion, overpriced for its quality. 

I am very disappointed and I hope this place recovers!

This place has some top notch food, no doubt about it! A friend and I went there for the first time and we loved it, I hope that I will be able to get there at least once the next time I'm in Phoenix. And, if I hear that any of my friends will be going to Phoenix, I'll be sure to recommend them to go to Jobot's! :)
Oh my word!!! Amazing food!! I recommend any crepe on the menu!! Friendly service but the bathroom is a little scary.

JoBot is the culture center of the Arts District. It just is. 

Layal said it best, It's where the artists and makers and movers and shakers and rebels and crazies and dreamers hang out. It's home.

The new JoBot site is being converted to a cool, gone are the bright white lights and in come the soft warm lights, local art and funkyness. Long live JoBot.

I had previously edited this review due to the building owner (not the business owner mind you) being very pet UNfriendly and not allowing dog on the property/patio. I guess the business owner has come to an agreement with the building owner ... not sure what that is but, the place does deserve a 5 star not withstanding.

The turkey pesto crepe was delicious, food was delivered quickly and the guy helping us was really friendly and made our experience there great! Thanks again Jobot for the yummy food& excellent iced coffee. definitely fulfilling
JoBot is in a very cool, laid back area of Phoenix.  Plenty of indoor and outdoor seating.  Cartel coffee is what brings this spot to four stars for me. I'd defintly go back.

Wish I could write a better review about this place but unfortunately there's such little customer service I didn't even get to experience it. I walked in and sat down, had every employee look at me, one even came by straightening the chairs. After sitting there for 10 minutes without any greeting or hello I observed another person walk in and up to the counter to order a coffee. So perhaps you order at the counter then sit and eat but I wouldn't know because everyone working there could have cared less I was there let alone care that I know how to order or what to suggest to order. Sadly I was looking forward to a crepe like in the Yelp pictures. No reason to return, no service to be found here.
Jobot is open 24hrs on Friday & Saturday with good coffee, good food, and relaxed chill atmosphere where even thou there is music playing a conversation can still be had.

Well, I've only been here about 10 times or so and I'm not in the habit of making reviews on Yelp simply bc I'm lazy.

The fact that they have an awesome version of lentil sammich is enough for me to give 5 stars. But I'm pretty easy going and the people there are rather friendly, or at least, easy going and not uptight. Ambiance is cozy and pretty relaxed. I met a lot of randos there, which is nice, cuz I generally like talking to strangers. I like the wooden floors and tables...except for the Ikea coffee table that's near the couch. Industrial fan blowing is quite handy... given the weather tends to be hot and sticky.

I like that it's quiet when they're opened 24 hours. I get a lot of work done.

Another great find, thanks to yelp!   Apple with bacon and strawberry crepe cakes and savory chorizo, spinach, mozzerella crepes! Both were outstanding and the apple with bacon crepes were a surprisingly great combo!  

This place wasn't the easiest to find, for some reason the gps directed us to a place a block away?  It looks like a house.  Cozy and the staff is friendly.

Oh. Mygod. Ohmygod. 

I thought the first time I came here and only enjoyed coffee that it was spectacular. Then I came back for the crepes. Consider my mind blown.

Not only does the outside have major curb appeal (LOVE the use of color), but you can sit at a coffee bar or outside... or in this whole other room. Come on. With that many seating options, there's something for everyone.

One night I was there, a movie was playing outside. This is the kind of place people can come back to. And the kind of place that Phoenix desperately needs downtown.

The stars reached their highest notch though when I went against my gut instinct and ordered the peanut butter cup crepe. See, I'm a huge fan of the Reese's cup. However, I feel it is nearly impossible to imitate. No one gets that flavor combination right and I end up being sadly disappointed.

If this is your fear too... order the peanut butter cup crepe from Jobot. It was like taking a bunch of Reese's and melting them in a crepe. I will still full from dinner, but I'll be damned if I didn't eat that entire thing.

The staff was super friendly, having conversations with a friend and I as we sat at the counter and indulged our sweet tooth ( is sweet teeth a word). I'll be back.. as often as I can manage :)

The staff was very helpful and polite. We had the Black Peach and Mint Green Teas (both iced) and they were delicious! I love the vibe of this cute little shop. Creativity oozed from every corner. We'll be back for sure!
Pretty much the best place in Arizona. That gaping hole in the north section of the state runs a close second, but they don't have coffee and comfortable seating up there.

My first time eating at Jobot! The number 4 with corn tortillas rocked my socks, sooo delicious! I felt healthy, light, satisfied and delighted when eating each bite. Just hit the spot! I shared the other two tacos with friends and they adored it just the same! The ingredients and flavor palate was intriguing & melt-worthy.

To drink, I had the African Rose tea which was a refreshing, beautiful field of flowers on my taste buds. I also had a chai after hearing a rave review about it from a local bookstore owner. I am a chai freak and after hearing about how good it was... I just had to try it! It was literally the best chai I've ever had. The perfect blend of spice and sweet. Felt like it was made just for my taste. Chai lattes are often overly sweet or powerfully spicy (the intensity of the spice overpowers the chai), but Jobot's recipe was puuuuuurrrfect. A mouthful of orgasmic bliss at each swallow.

And the environment was very warm and welcoming, friendly faces and great service! Art on the walls of "local community heroes" by Aaron was great to see! And extra bonus, Jobot is located right next to Aaron's bookstore, Lawn Gnome Publishing & Bookstore! My first time there as well. It is a breath of positivity, inspiration and creativity! I will be definitely frequenting them both! Visit Jobot & Lawn Gnome now! ;D

The shops on this small street are examples of repurposed real estate. I've wanted to stop in the coffee shop on the way to work. With time to spare this morning, I dropped by for my morning coffee. The shop had opened at 7 and there was already a lively conversation at the coffee bar. The menu had a good variety of coffee drinks, basic but covered the full spectrum. I decided on a cappuccino. Care was taken to remove bubbles from the steamed milk. The taste was extremely good and the expression made to perfection. By default it was put into a paper to go cup; next time I will ask for a "for here" cup. The place is comfortable. Tables inside have a 50's style chrome edge and the chairs remind me of circa 70s school cafeteria. There are plenty of places to sit (open till midnight).  

Great option for those who prefer indie coffee shops.

I have heard great things from a handful of friends, and have lived in the Artisan Village for about a year and a half.  That being said I finally ventured over with my wife and mother in law for some of their crepes.  The owner happened to be there and the one that "helped" us.  We were first ignored for a while due to the simple disorganization of the business.  We ordered the root beer pulled pork crepe, the tuna melt, and the chorizo with egg crepe.  The owner wrote down the order but "forgot" about the tuna melt that my mother in law ordered, I have held many positions within the food service industry from server to bartender up to general manager so I understand that mistakes get made, no big deal.  He got the remainder of our order out to us and the tuna tasted like tuna right out of the can with nothing else wrapped in a crepe.  The root beer pulled pork which was the most dry pulled pork I have ever had, but the overall flavor was lacking as well.  I let the owner know of my disapointment and his response was simply "that's too bad".  I have been in the same situation many times in my experience in restaurants, the difference was the effort put in to keep a patron for repeat business which will not happen.  If you are looking for a good coffee and snack I would recomment looking into either the Tamico/M&J Bread company on Roosevelt in Artisan Village or even Conspire the funky co-op at the end of the street.  I am not one to rant or even complain, but this is not the way to treat any customers especially ones like myself and my wife who would have been frequent patrons of the establishment which is now out of the question.  It certainly is a cozy, laid back, comfortable atmosphere, I would just expect higher quality and a more genuine caring attitude towards local paying customers as a supporter of local businesses.  His complacent attitude left me wondering if we had dressed the part of a certain role we would have been better taken care of.

Summertime wears me out. Their iced mocha hit the spot.

Want to come back to try a toddy, I guess it's iced coffee that is cold brewed, rather than the normal hot brew, so it tastes better. 

Their crepe menu makes me drool too.

There's a special little place in my heart designated specifically for JoBot, so I'm thrilled to be the 100th person to get to sing the praises of this adorable little coffee shop/creperie/hole-in-the-wall bundle of amazing-ness.

I came across JoBot by accident about a year ago while looking for a late night wi-fi spot to do some studying. It fit the bill perfectly, minus the fact that it was extremely difficult to concentrate with the loud music coming from the Lost Leaf, the interesting conversations that I couldn't help from overhearing, and the endless amount of scrumptious plates that kept parading past me. 

That said, I've made several "study" trips to JoBot since. While I may not be as productive as I would be at some of those quieter little coffee shops where everyone has their nose in a book or a laptop, I find that I always walk away a very happy camper, every time. 

Their crepes/tacos are delicious. All of them. Sometimes I feel as though the crepes are slightly undercooked, but once I dig inside to discover the tantalizing flavors that lie within, I tend to forget all about that. The root beer pork remains one of my faves followed by a strawberry/banana concoction for dessert. Yum, yum, yum.

Go here if you want good coffee (the bumble bee is tasty), good eats, good conversation, good atmosphere, good prices, good entertainment, and free wi-fi at any and all hours (they don't seem to close on weekends). And if you're really feeling frisky head down a house or two for some NachoBot. Gosh I love this place.

Parking was free and and close to the location...all though they were packed (line out the door) Tabitha was able serve us delicious crepes and coffee in a short amount of time...the best downtown has to offer

Two words:  SMELLY and DIRTY!  Do not, I repeat, do not go to Jobot if you are hoping for a good environment, clean areas, or a decent crowd.  Is everyone doing these reviews blind??!  I am so disappointed too because I kept hearing about Jobot from multiple people, so I really wanted to check it out and see what it was like.  The cup of iced coffee I had was good, but that is the only positive comment I can make.  The customer service was so-so, the crowd there seemed sketchy and I just generally did not feel welcome or comfortable here.  I will not be back.

Jobot is back with an expanded space only a couple blocks away from their original location! Same hours. Same great atmosphere! It's great how they've transformed the space to make it their own. Come check out one of your new favorite hangout spots in DTPHX!

This is a regular hang-out spot for me and my friends. We come here late at night all the time for coffee and food. It has easily become one of my favorite coffee shops downtown. The coffee and food are awesome! I love that they stay open until midnight every night (and 24 hours on the weekend with a full menu)! It can become really packed inside at night as many people hang out here, but there is plenty of outside seating as well. Give it a try!

I'm usually down at Roosevelt Row at least two to three times a week, and this is the first time I've visited Jobot, and I'm kicking myself. The second I walked in I was greeted by the biggest smile and hello.  I told them I'd never been in before so they gave me a few ideas of a few teas. I chose the Blue Bot Tea and The Jomama breakfast sandwich. The tea was citrusy and so much flavor. It was great even without adding sweetener. The sandwich came out with fresh fruit and the presentation was amazing. I had read another yelp review about how messy it can get, and they weren't joking. One bite and egg yolk was running everywhere. All I have to say about that is get extra napkins because this sandwich was to die for. Literally no joke the best sandwich I've ever had! The wait was less than five minutes from the time I walked in the door to it being brought to me at my table. I chose to sit on the patio because the weather was perfect being so early in the morning. There are quite a few picnic tables with umbrellas. Very clean set up. The inside is very welcoming and you can tell it's a popular place with many regulars. Many high tables tops and a huge bar. Great place, amazing service, and again the BEST breakfast sandwich of my life! Check them out!

3/31/16

3.25 stars.

Finally made it out here-- I bookmarked this place years ago!

I arrived around a quarter to 11 am, so I'd missed out on a few pastries.  Since it was my first time here, I stood out of line to have a look at the pastry case, as well as check out the menu.  I don't enjoy looking up at wall menus above, so I probably missed out on some cool daily specials...  If you haven't visited Jobot before, you order at the counter and pay, receive an order number to take with you to your table of choice, and then wait for your hot food items to be delivered to you.  (Read between the lines: you MUST retrieve your coffee beverage/s at the counter.  Understandable if ordering drinks to-go, but a little annoying when dining in, but OK.)  The only powdered sugar-free items left, besides savory rolls, were brownies ($2.75?) and brownie cookies ($1.75?), so I bought one of each.  I also ordered a cappuccino ($3.50), a Short Stack of Buttermilk Pancakes with Blueberry-Ginger compote ($8.50), and a side of bacon ($3).  I asked for no powdered sugar on the pancakes, as well as omission of the vanilla maple syrup, since the cashier knew that they'd recently switched from pure maple syrup to one that was a corn syrup blend.  (Kudos to him for knowing that info without having to ask someone in the kitchen!  Love it!)  I also asked if the whipped cream was homemade or from a bottle and was told it was fresh whipped, so I was looking forward to experiencing it.  Paid with a credit card on the iPad, so I didn't get to see my receipt until a few hours later, while I was at the art museum.

Cappuccino was lovely- not so much the coffee art- but the flavors and the mouth-feel. https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/jobot-coffee-and-diner-phoenix?select=OsmHkS0MntBnn2sUB6z8Zg  I don't add sweeteners to cappuccinos and drip coffees, since I usually pair them with sweet breakfast items.  I could taste the natural sweetness of the milk used- a very nice cup!  The two pastries were delicious: the brownie cookie had great textures and was moderately-sweet. https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/jobot-coffee-and-diner-phoenix?select=dJy7dqlEc30gefk8AXTdEw  The brownie was very tender and had intense chocolate flavor!  Found it a tad too sweet, though, so I preferred the cookie.  (Strange, as I've always had a fondness for brownies.)  The short stack of pancakes were definitely short! https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/jobot-coffee-and-diner-phoenix?select=GbBHngF-ROVPxqrm7vca6g  These were flat cakes, so I was glad to see the amount of blueberry compote on top.  I didn't see any ginger in the compote, though, so I was a little worried, and the whipped cream looked and tasted like it came out of a ReadyWhip canister.  Still, I enjoyed a bit of it swirled into the very sweet compote.  I thought the cakes were OK, with the blueberry compote a bit too sweet, until my tongue and teeth discovered chewy bits of spicy ginger here and there, and then I started to enjoy the entree!  And I was worried at the beginning, because the wafts of pork I detected smelt a bit funky.  The bacon looked soggy, too, but I took the plunge and bit into them and found the meat parts crispy enough.  I only eat bacon fat when they're crisped, so I was happy to be able to pick through the inedible fat (to me!) and count my blessings to be able to skim off some calories this way.

It's very small inside, and there's really only two tables that are welcoming (the community tables at the back).  There were some nice two-tops, but they're spaced very close to one another, and most were taken by other customers.  I also try to find tables with good lighting around them, so that I may take decent pictures, so I was glad that a young man didn't mind sharing a 4-top community table with me.  (He had his laptop, so I didn't want to encroach on his personal space...)

One HUGE complaint I have?  The loud, creaky wooden floor!  I understand this used to be a home (like many other PHX eateries), but OMG, so disruptive!  I wondered how people could study or do computer work here, but now I realized that most people nowadays use earbuds while working and thus can ignore other sounds, but I'm not one of those people.  [On the rare occasion you see me wearing earbuds, I only have them on in case a call comes through.  The only music/sounds I listen to while dining out are the ones playing in the restaurant, bird songs (if patio-dining), or conversations of loud patrons.]  Having written all that, I'd return again, to enjoy more coffee and perhaps try the sandwiches.  Hope to be able to increase my rating to four stars- we'll see!

Every time and I mean EVERYTIME I want a donut ice cream sandwich from the Melt ice cream stand outside they are ALWAYS out!! I find it especially funny when inside I look in the pastry case and there is a huge array of donuts  also employees there were not friendly at all, not the vibe you want from a "unique" coffee joint..

Super cute coffee shop. I had a hot caramel mocha and the boyfriend had an iced caramel latte. Both were super yummy. Definitely will be coming back.

I tried their chocolate pecan fudge. Delicious. Pastries are $1 off after 7pm for happy hour. 

You can park in the parking garage next door for 2 hours for free.

I've been a fan of Jobot since way back. It's been a neighborhood staple that serves up some pretty good jo and tasty bites. The new location is no different. Even though I moved away I make a point of visiting every time I'm in town.
i dragged my friends around on foot to find this place staffed by hipsters making good coffee and good crepes. i'm sure they, like i, thought that walk was worth it.

So, here's the story..... I don't know what people consider as good food or a "hip environment" but this place doesn't have either! The lack of cleanliness should have been a warning to just turn around and walk out, but I said "no, lets try it... After all many people on yelp gave it 4 and 5 star reviews".  To be honest, I was excited and that made me sad because I took my friend with me, due to the rave reviews.
First off, The food is nothing to write home about, ordered the breakfast "joritto", and was like mush in a tortilla (bless their little hearts), and there was a cake out in the open which was being sold by the slice - mind you, it was right next to the cash register! I mean, yuk! People talking and handling money over slices of cake for human consumption?! And don't get me started on the dirty seating, deteriorating wood floors, busted wall above the coffee bar, no working AC, and cob webs and dust all over the windows! I seriously almost threw up eating my breakfast burrito when I felt something crawl on the side of my foot. It was just a whack place in the heart of Phoenix that should be closed down... Or they should detox the place and clean up the staff, and improve hygiene standards before preparing food for people... :(

I am still in shock over the fact that I lowered my standards to eat here. Such a disappointment... If you're used to living in sanitary surroundings, DON'T COME HERE!!!

Dude at the counter was cool, but service was botched. Don't care. Crepes were effin' amazing, and ENORMOUS. Sweet or savory, doesn't matter. They're awesome. And there's enough choices to keep you busy for weeks.

Cool, comfy, and unique. Would go there daily if I lived in the area. Love the converted home vibe.

My favorite coffee place closed recently so I tried the next closest place. I love a good dirty chai (chai with espresso in it). I ordered a large iced chai and wanted 2% milk, and was told they did not have it. So I asked if they could mix a bit of whole and skim, only to be told they ONLY had whole, almond or soy. I went with the almond milk. As for the chai, it was SO SPICY it gave me heartburn. WAY too much clove or nutmeg or something. On top of that there were LOTS of coffee grounds in the bottom of the cup. I REALLY wish I had tasted it before I drove off as I would have ordered something else or gotten my money back. I drank about 1/8 of it and had to throw it away.

Jobot is a gem. Seriously. Location, customer service and food selection are amazing. I've had lunch here twice in the past week and both times I was very pleasantly surprised with the quality food I had. The Curry was perfect. The. Shorty sounds alright but damn it was fantastic. And the customer service there is great. good vibes all around.
Super cute little place. Walked in to try a coffee. Got a caramel vanilla iced latte. Seriously so good. The vibe in there was nice and mellow. Everyone was super nice! Will def be back!!
A Phoenix coffee shop open past 9pm? Praise the baby Jesus!

This used to be Oliver's sophisticated bean. The espresso is still delicious, food is  good and better prices now. The atmosphere is chill and cozy. Good for getting work done or hanging out with friends.

Honestly, JoBot just feels good. It's the type of place that welcomes anyone at almost anytime for almost any reason -- I come here to write, to catch up with friends, do homework, for a cup of tea after a hard day or a cup of coffee before a good one. I've lived in Phoenix/Tempe for three years, and although actively searching, I have not found somewhere that does a better job at creating a place to come back to. It's so...itself. I love the authenticity. 

And the people here are interesting. 

The food is great. The drinks are great. I'm not sure what else to say. JoBot is quality.

Came for breakfast on a Sunday morning around 9am. 
Wasn't crowded at all (+) - ordered a cold brew and the chilaquiles. The chilaquiles was described to me like a breakfast lasagna - I thought of it more like breakfast nachos. Either way, was heavily spiced in all the right ways and left a warm taste even after you're done chewing (+). Wasn't disappointed. Also huge portion - could've been shared (+). The cold brew was good too. Splashed a bit of soy and was happy. Usually cold brews come off aggressive to me, but this one was good. 

We also got a Jomama breakfast sandwich and the bottomless drip. Also delicious! 

Tips:
- Dogs welcome - saw a couple sitting outside (+).
- free garage parking in the garage off 3rd street - follow the Jobot sign for parking (++).

Edit: Why are the bathrooms so dark? ?
Was in Paris 2 months ago and this crepe is as authentic as it comes. Dare I say possibly even better. I always go savory over sweet, but I may have to reconsider!

I love Jobot...but...the girls really need to put their hair in nets. Pulling three long hairs off of my plate is kinda gross.

That's all. Everything else is good. Portions, food, friendly staff and relaxed atmosphere.

Hands down the best coffee spot in Phoenix! Super clean, cozy, everyone's nice, food is on point! Our go to spot every year from Texas! Not to mention the owner is super nice! Don't forget to check out his newly opened beer gallery across the street! Carries the most beer options in Phoenix thus far!

My friend Jenny P (check out her reviews too!) took me to JoBot for lunch, and treated me to a crepe. Yum yum yum! I had the Black Bean Crepe, and ordered it with an egg ($1 extra). The crepe was served with a side of spicy red sauce, which was delicious!!! We sat outside, and enjoyed the spring weather under an umbrella. JoBot recently added canopies to provide more outdoor shade, and the owner said they're going to try to add a mister system too. I didn't have any room for dessert, so I'll have to come back for a sweet crepe next time.
Came in a few days ago, not knowing what I wanted to drink. The barista Devin was super nice and recommended me a drink, and made me the most amazing dirty chai latte! Thank you so much Devin!
Solid coffee (plain). Food is meh.

I am in love with this place! They have outdoor patios, so you can sit and enjoy your coffee or read a book. Also the people here are very friendly. Customer service is amazing they are willingly to help pick the prefect coffee for you. :) Best place in Phoenix. wish they had one in Tempe.

Why do these aholes act like I haven't been going there for years? Btw I've spent thousands on their crud coffee and they seem inconvenienced by me paying them money. I actually stopped going as much cuz the girls in there act like I am some sort of cro magnon. Sorry if I like things like NFL and showering! Apparently you do not, but please stop spreading your disdain at random. I get it. No time for pleasentries right? You suck Jobot life is better than you are acting
Decent food, but HORRIBLE customer service. Good riddance!

Came here for breakfast with a friend. Started with a delicious cold brew coffee and ordered biscuits and gravy. Not traditional gravy, but a smokey, bold, spicy gravy was served on two fresh biscuits. Two over easy eggs and some potatoes on the side. Absolutely delightful. Friendly staff and cool atmosphere. Will definately return.
Nice place to sit n comfy

Spacious with bar seating both indoors and outdoors. They have big picnic tables (shaded) outside so great for groups too.

I am more of a tea person and they offer plenty options and to my surprise they freshly brew it when ordered and it's delicious. I got peach tea which I really like here. 

Located on a quiet street even though lots of graffiti around. I was a little skeptical when I first drove in but super peaceful. Have the perfect atmosphere to relax or get work done. 24hrs on the weekend is awesome! 

Will have to try their crepes next time. Wish they displayed their food menu also. Or maybe I was unable to locate it

I'm so sad! My co-workers actually took me to this place about a month ago and I took my husband last week, on their last day. I love how you walk in and you step into the past of where this house has been. You have a historical feeling with the chimney inside and that living room feeling.  

They have really delicious crepes and coffee, people there are so nice, and even outside with the table in the concrete yard with the lights hanging. It's really really sad to know they are tearing down these historical homes to bring in the corporate development to make it modern.

At least we got to enjoy a piece of this business before they closed down.

Delicious coffee and savory crêpes (ham, Swiss cheese, spinach, and Dijon is my go-to). If you can wait.

Short-staffed, this is not a late-night mecca of efficiency. Variable and inexplicable waits should be planned for and embraced.

Came here with little sister a while back and had the black tea and strawberries and creme crepe, both were delicious. The space is kinda small and rundown, but the tea was brewed perfectly. The barista knows what he's doing although he seems a little standoffish. My sister thinks he's rude, but she loves their chicken salad. Two drinks, salad and crepe came to over 20 bucks, so they are a bit overpriced. I'd come again if I found myself in the neighborhood.

I like the vibe of the place and it is well known because of First Friday. But I think they rely on too much with the vibe they try to give off and not enough with customer service. They need to understand although me and other people may not be in their circle, I would like a sense of respect because I am still a paying customer. Maybe if they extended themselves outside of their inner circle, they can get more revenue.

Jobot never ceases to impress. Definitely have my favorite breakfast burritos, fantastic beverages and a great environment. This local spot curates craft coffee, beer, cocktails, and noms. Their new location features a spacious cafe with lots of comfy seating!

It's my first time here and I'm in love! My breakfast sandwich was AMAZING! I will be craving that for the rest of the week, and my coffee was so good I couldn't leave without getting a second one to go. I highly recommend stopping in for breakfast.

Wow, just wow! A Yelper recommended this place for its crepes and coffee, and he was dead on. There are simply so many great choices on the crepes menu (check the back of the menu too for the savory crepes that are more the lunch or dinner type). 

I ordered Crepe F, which had apple fritter, honey and granola in or on my incredible tasting crepe. The almond milk latte was also excellent.

My group sat outside to enjoy the sunshine and the live music playing. Great place!
They have Ms. Pac-Man, craft beer, scratch made biscuits and gravy, DJ's every Sunday for Beats & Brunch and the best cold brew coffee in Downtown Phoenix. Nuff said

I've eaten at JoBot over 200 times since they've opened. I've never been sick once from eating or drinking there. Anyone who thinks the place is "dirty" doesn't understand that it's clean where it matters: in the kitchen. Check their health inspection history for yourself . Still bothered by the practical use of reclaimed materials, unfinished construction and make-shift furniture? Please take your pampered ass back to the suburbs and drown yourself in a bath in Purell, the regulars love this place.
Nice atmosphere and great breakfast chorizo burrito. Coming from Tucson so yeah we take chorizo serious. Great coffee! Overall a great time!
One of my favorite lunch spots. Cool atmosphere and the savory crepes are great- I always go with the number 10. They have an awesome selection of Italian sodas and coffee too.

I love this place, it's hit its urban its me. They've added some things to their menu that I haven't tried and today I tried it, loved the green white chile cheese fries, DELISH! I also myself got a chai latte iced with almond milk pretty awesome chai here folks. Service was awesome matched the environment and feel but very friendly! With my chai I got a savory crepe for breakfast cause I was craving it! And I got the number 2, it had chorizo mozzarella topped with a n over easy egg I think! It was fantastic I loved it! I definitely would recommend all my friends and future friends here! Especially if you are in the downtown Roosevelt area! Plus it's all local which I love!

I thought it was ok, hubby thought it was spectacular.  I tried to order my standard soy vanilla latte but they were out of vanilla - to me that's like a hamburger joint being out of ketchup.  So I got a mocha instead - nice coffee flavor, but the chocolate didn't taste so special.  Hubby had a cappuccino and would definitely get it again.

This place was sooooo good. I wasn't expecting much from the food with it being a coffee shop but we were pleasantly surprised! I got the yellow curry and was seriously better than a traditional Thai spot, we also got the quesadilla and it was one of the best ever! Defiantly a must try!!

Rumors of Jobot's death were greatly exaggerated! Mere days after closing doors on the iconic 5th street, they somehow lucked into a space previously owned by another failing coffee shop. Its reemergence was hasty, with old signage from the establishment's past life still fixed above the entrance. Juxtaposed with an ironic "NOT JOBOT" sign, there seemed to be a bit of an identity crisis as the wooden, kitsch, and artful charm were supplanted by sleek and steely modernity of Roosevelt's 'renewal'. But is this still the coffee shop I've known and enjoyed and visited a million times, despite everything being replaced? 

It's like the Ship of Theseus, if you retained reliable, bespectacled baristas. 

I assure you the coffee is as tasty and invigorating as always. Everything you order will be good, but I really do believe you should stick with the Sunrise, an avant-garde mixture of espresso and orange juice. Delicious! 

The food has perhaps retained more consistency than ever! No more hit-or-miss dishes, my order has been good every time. Get the crepes. Get the BLT with avocado first. I must add their red salsa is heavenly, and is crazy good despite its mildness. 

The most noteworthy change here is the bar. It has evolved from a selection of several brews offered occasionally to a concept that has been fully realized. It even boasts a small cocktail menu! And while you can obviously find a more expansive or refined selection elsewhere, it's more than what one could hope for in a coffee shop. 

I completely understand the disappointment from long-time patrons. It just doesn't *feel* the way it's supposed to, and that may hamper your enjoyment for quite some time. I will always miss the creaky floors and broken doors with graffiti and 3am conversations on the patio, but doting on them is a lost cause. This is the now, and judging Jobot on its merits alone in this new space leaves me with just one reasonable conclusion - it's totally worth.

Before and after pounding obscure craft beers next door, JoBot is always a good idea. The soy mocha is one of the best in the business. More importantly their menu doesn't mess around when it comes to grabbing some late night eats. I recommend the BLT, with its lemon zest cream cheese, but more importantly, the salad that comes with it. Or the vegan salad. Or the crepes. Or the tacos. 

Just order anything. It's all good. 

So just a recap, this is why I'm giving Jobot 5 stars:


+Open late
+Awesome patio
+Quick service
+Good value on quality food and joe
Always a fan of the late night festivities that go on here when the bars close.  The food is always great but depending on the time you'll have a wait.  Just be patient and you'll love what you get.

I've been to Jobot about 5 times since I moved to Phoenix less than a year ago. On the quest for coffee shops/cafes to do some work in the Phoenix metro area, Jobot is pretty high up on my list.

I always get the iced mocha latte and it never disappoints! Since I come here to do work with my laptop, I always try to aim for seats near the outlets but just like any other place, I wish there were more of them! They are open late, which is when I usually come, so thankfully this hasn't been that big of an issue for me since there are less people. Wifi is reliable. The overall vibe is chill. Some parts of the indoor area have pretty dim lighting, so if you're doing some reading, outdoors might be the better option.

Parking hasn't been too bad. I park on the ground floor of the apartment building that Jobot is a part of. The downside is that it is 2 hour max for parking. I'm not sure how strict they enforce this during the day, but since I come 6 pm or later, this hasn't been an issue for me if I stay longer.
Amazing crepes, good coffee, open late. I come here at least once a week. Highly recommend the ham and spinach or chocolate/peanut butter crepe! Love this place.

Wasn't impressed. I usually love these little hole in the wall places owned by locals and. This place just didnt do it for me. It was a little dirty, the workers were all pretty distracted and taking their sweet time and the music was SOOOO loud for 7am.

Sigh, i wish it had lived up to my expectations.

I have been eating here and enjoying cartel coffee since before you were too cool to crack a smile or I don't know be polite. unkept hair and a vacant expression doesn't do much for my restaurant experience.

I have been very forgiving because I loved this place when we found it after you opened. I came for the biscuits and gravy and got an enormous pubic hair on top a few months ago. That was my first bad experience. Not because of the hair because let's be honest, shit happens and we all shed, but there was no apology. No omg that is awful let me get you a new one!!!! Instead the guy with perfected hipster hair said oh i don't think it's a pube just a wiry hair. seriously??

I came three weeks ago with my 5lb dog. I carried him in so I could order and he would not freak out. The manager just stared at me like I had active head lice and monotonously took my order. She then said you can wait outside. LOL I know I had a dog and I wanted nothing more than to get outside. But you still say thank you for buying something in my establishment or at least say hey...jerk...get that dog out of here. On this occasion the breakfast potatoes were not cooked. I said nothing because I didn't want them anyway.

So today I stop in because I have a paper to write. First of all nobody smiles, nobody says hey, nothing. Then I order and wait quite awhile. So I see her with my food and smile and say I think that's mine. I get no smile in return. Instead she says you didn't take a number. i'd have known if you had taken a number. And she leaves without giving me the silverwear. The biscuits were stale and dry but again I said nothing because this time I know I am over it.

You know your crepes are decent, coffee is awesome, but your people are unfriendly and you are not half as cool as you think you are. I work too hard for my money. I'm gonna go to phoenix market, they sell the same coffee and never put pubes in my food. They also say thank you.

Cute spot we decide to stop by and get some coffee and something sweet. Got the crepe and it was good. The CHAI TEA Latte took 23min and even after asking other drinks still came out except mine. After I was done with the crepe my chai was done. It was watered down :/

DO NOT CoME HERE
Freaking BEST baker in AZ. Sampled the Strawberry and Almond Donuts with a friend. Both were beyond our expectations. Almond was my favorite!

I first tried this place in order to see a friend perform with his band. The crepes brought me back for return visits, as they really really hit the spot. This place is janky in a good way... down-to-earth people serving and patronizing the joint. Just the kind of place for an indie band jam and poetry slam. And it's right next to The Lost Leaf if you need to switch from stimulants to depressants (or vice versa). The owners next door at Lost Leaf are totally cool with you bringing your awesome JoBot crepes over to consume with your beer.

This is a great example of local flavor that I hope propagates in downtown Phoenix. It's places like this that make me linger longer after work and put off my commute eastward for some cool vibes with the local ilk.

I really wanted to like this place ...

Like in my previous reviews for coffee shops and the like I look for good coffee and a great studying atmosphere. Upon my visit I came in, grabbed a cold brew and tried studying. Wasn't very busy in the shop, so sound was not an issue. I found my cold brew to be just alright, but a more watered down than I would have liked. I also that it was odd to watch them make cold brew/steep tea right on the counter in an industrial container, swirling the bag around the water. Talk about fresh though, right?

I didn't find the environment that great, I thought it lacked outlets for those using laptops. The table was wobbly and the chairs weren't that comfortable. Like the rest of the shops and cafes in downtown that are quirky and cool, I found JoBot kind of dingy.

Perhaps cold brew was a bad option, as well as staying in here. From the looks of it, JoBot looks like a grab & go kind of place. As for what other reviewers are saying, looks like Chai and the Crepes are a big hit here.

The rating is more 3.75/5 than 3/5. 

Its one of those hole-in-the-walls that people go to for some latenight coffee and food. I specifically go there for only one reason - Drunk food when I am done with Lost Leaf ! oh wait or when I go to frist fridays and get drunk as well (despit eating at the bazillion food trucks :)). 

Why? I dont know, its one of the only real late late night food places that's open and that's not Mcdy or Jack in the box. That Said, I would still prefer Aside of Heart or Nachebot to this place for the food. I have had the crepes here before and they are good (check the pics). doesn't anything taste goooood when youz drunk? :P. wait a min, what's the yardstick to compare these crepes with? what r the other good places with crepes here? I have eaten something else here before too, I can't remember now though I think its veggie quesedilla/burrito? I liked em too. But hey you pay 7-10$ for the drunk food here

My relationship with this coffee shop is more complicated than my relationship with my boyfriend. I stated going here less than six months ago and they have changed locations, management, menus, prices so many times I just can't even keep it straight. Every time they make a change that I dislike and make me upset, they come out with something new that I love that makes up for it. I just wish they would still have the monte cristo crepe. I love their Elvis crepe with the bacon and peanut butter and yesterday I tried their udon  noodles and it was sooo yummy. Their cold brew is their own coffee roast and it is so tasty and they have me addicted, so when ever I'm unhappy about the food, prices or location, I still will always keep coming here because you jus can't get coffee like that anywhere else. I also love all their pastries and that they always have vegan options.

Best plain latte I've ever tasted.
Ambience isn't much to speak of, old house but the breakfast sandwich was spectacular. 
Prices are very reasonable.
Barista was a craftsman!

Great crepes, very yummy, good espresso, but I do not like the vibe in this place. There was a lot of body parts art. Some of us are not up for fallices and breasts with our crepes and espressos.
