Felt a little dirty too meaning clean not moral. So, a mixed review for this one. Was not amazing enough to draw me back in.

5 stars all day (and all night)! Chill, eclectic, funky, smooth...legit! Food, coffee, ambience, JOBOT has it. Reminds me of Church St back home, downtown Burlington, Vermont. 

Short review, no need for anything longer...if you like great food and great beverages then you need to come here. :D

Eh ....this place definitely is not very customer service oriented ..but however the reason I'm here is because im hungry. Super urban Hipster which immmm soooooooooooooooo over .... was cute for a min when you actually genuinely meet and see a true urban Hipster not a bunch of wanna bees dressed like hipsters ....super tried !! And tired! Anyhow ill post a review on the food ...once its ready still waiting .... too bee continued ........
Delicious egg sandwich and good strong coffee  Music is played loud on Sunday afternoons so it's not the best place to study.

The staff here is always friendly & welcoming. There are a lot of beverages options, but if there's something you want that's not on the menu, ask. There's a good chance they can make it for you. The pastries are always fresh & delicious. I have yet to eat an actual meal here, but I've heard nothing but great things.

Checked out JoBot for the first time this morning with my husband and son.  I got a delicious chai latte and my husband had the drip.  Kiddo had a strawberry-almond scone which the three of us devoured.  Loved the patio... can't wait to come back.

Parking for this place is in a garage a short walk around the corner. The owner was super nice and struck up some conversation with us which I enjoyed. The barista wasn't the most personable but she was still polite. I asked for an iced macchiato, however she told me that they only make the traditional ones. I don't know why it would've been an issue to accommodate my request seeing as I just wanted an iced version of something already on the menu. I ended up getting an iced white chocolate mocha which was good and the prices were very reasonable. They seem to have a large selection of beers as well, but we stopped in for a morning cup of coffee. I absolutely loved the industrial atmosphere and neat decor they had. I would go back!

A few of my favorite things:

Places that seem hidden, crepes, and definitely coffee.

This place has never disappointed. The Baristas are friendly and explain the art of coffee to you, the crepes are delightful.. The Chai was OK. but I'm rating this based on Coffee.
My friends always take me here when I visit Phoenix. And for a good reason. The drinks are tasty and they're open late! Plenty of patio seating, which is perfect for those cooler nights in Phoenix.
Great coffee and the biscuits and gravy are the best. Also all of the baked goods are always moist and delicious never too sweet

Cool little hipster spot. Espresso was good. I love those crepes. Not the best I've ever had but really good. I like the spot, right in the arts district downtown. Always have fun when I'm there. Good place. Good times. Great late night food and coffee.

Extremely hipster, I wanted to stay and get some reading done but it didn't feel the most welcoming. Aside from that, the baked goods were amazing! Major compliments to whoever is back there, the lavender chocolate chip cookies and lemon-rosemary cake were fantastic. Butter is certainly present, but they are worth it. I'd visit again, but keep it as a to-go order.

First off, what a great addition to the neighborhood. We needed a coffee shop that wasn't a weird, haphazard array of junk scattered about(Conspire.) We also needed to be rid of that shiester Derek who ran Hoodride, so 5 stars for Jobot for killing two birds with one stone. 

This is actually a neat little coffee shop with a bar where you can sit and feel like you are at the pub but drink coffee instead. I haven't seen a coffee counter since Drip on 7th Street closed. Huge kudos for that and another five stars.

Unfortunately, they were out of coffee on my visit. The guy behind the counter was very cordial and offered to brew a pot but I was in a bit of a rush to get back to work. I was happy to order an Americano, but I felt that still charging me full price for it was kind of unfortunate, and the quality and taste was less than exceptional. Generally, if a place is out of something, they will offer you something else and charge you the price of what you originally wanted. And generally, a two-shot Americano will keep me feeling awake and energetic, but this was very watered down and didn't taste that great either.

I'll definitely hang out here when I need a fix, but more because it's just a neat little place, and not because of it's coffee. Otherwise, Giant and Lux are far superior when it comes to the drinks and they are a little fancier.

This place gave me the crepes. And they were delightful!

My friends and I stopped by one late October evening after catching a show at Valley Bar and were glad we did. What better way to end a great day than with the most important meal of the day, breakfast.
Coffee is fantastic and the crepes are good. Service is no different than what I've experienced at other "hipster" hangouts; it's a bit standoffish. They warm up to you after awhile though.

Dropped into JoBot Coffee several weeks ago with a friend and was pleasantly surprised to find they are located in a historic phoenix home converted into a coffee bar. The barista's were courteous and attentive and they serve a great Americano. Yeah, I'm a fan and I'll be back!!!

Leaving Matt's low on caffeine and realizing Jiffy-Lube and Chase were not yet open to accomplish my afternoon errands I decided to next pay a visit to Jobot Coffee - a place I'd heard both good (music, coffee) and less-than-stellar (patrons, service) things about and pointing my GPS to the address I at first wondered if I'd mistyped; to say the least the area is residential and unassuming, but upon seeing the "Coffee" sign I assumed I was in the right place, parked, and walked in as Sigur Ros Takk played on the outdoor speakers.

Half knowing what to expect from a house-come-coffee shop named the "best place to take a scenester" by the local media I entered the doors of JoBot to the aromatics of coffee and a bar populated by the partially hung-over and half-shaven but surprisingly also to smiling faces and families sitting with their Ipads as the kitchen turned out respectable looking sweet and savory crepes.  Not realizing that the space served food in addition to coffee I was greeted by a young lady at the bar who asked if I wanted a menu or if I knew what I'd like I deferred for a moment while I perused the options - eventually settling on an iced Toddy and a pair of pastries made in-house that morning - a $10 tab including a $1 tip.

With the space almost intentionally run-down looking and tables, benches, and chairs strewn throughout three rooms I found bench and 2 tables near the back where a defunct piano sat alongside a family of four and after getting out my books took my first sip of the Toddy - a rich blend from Cartel with a bit of stone-fruit up front and deep chocolate notes on the finish before moving on to my pastries - a $2.50 Strawberry "DohNut" and a $4.00 slice of Dr. Pepper Cake.  Beginning first with the donut - a small ring that was possibly baked rather than fried given the total lack of grease, rich cake-like texture, and pockets of berries plus an ample coat of not-too-sweet strawberry glaze I have to say the it was more 'muffin' than donut, but all in all it was still quite good.  Moving next to the cake - dense, fudgy, and just bitter enough between the cocoa and the nuts to balance the saccharine sweetness of the soda it has been a long long time since I ordered something as simple as "chocolate cake" and while there is no doubt I could have made something like this at home it was a really nice reminder of how good 'comfort food' can sometimes be - particularly with really good coffee in a relaxed setting.

Their mocha is disappointing.. no taste of coffee at all.. it  neither tastes like a chocolate drink.. to sum, it's bland.. the price is also on the high end.. for the price of their small mocha is the same price for the medium mocha at One coffee..

We went for crepes and we had crepes and we were pleased.
That would be an understatement, we were in heaven. The crepes were to die for! They had flavor that oozed more flavor. Each and every bite was a gastronomic masterpiece of flavor. Did I already mention the flavor?
The coffee that accompanied the crepes was also wonderful. Not quite exquisite, just wonderful.
When we arrived the music being played was David Bowie's Ziggy Stardust album and the DJ outside was blasting out some awesome Santana tunes.
And the sun was shining and life was good.
This place is an all around A #1, five star coffee shop with a cool vibe. 
This is definitely on my return as soon as possible list. 
Bring your bike, your electronic communication device (or a good book) and enjoy this wonderful oasis of cool eats in Phoenix.

Great, great coffee. I haven't tried the crepes but from what I've heard they are good. My hesitancy with giving it 4 or 5 stars is the cleanliness or lack there of. I like the local charm , but the owner should look to spruce things up  bit

One of the best iced lattes I've ever had!  I drank it so fast I thought about ordering another one.  It's a good thing I didn't order a second one because I would have never gone to sleep.  I love a caffeine-filled latte.  It's in an old downtown house and there are tables in the front yard.  It was nice to relax outside and enjoy the beautful day with a delicious drink.  There's so many great reviews about the crepes, I can't wait to go back and try them!

Unfortunately I have to follow other reviews of this place in saying that It's not what I expected. 
This was one of the places friends recommended to me knowing that I have high standards when it comes to coffee. 
The cappuccino I ordered was bad, though. Overextracted, burnt and sour.

Always great to come back. I miss the brunches i used to attend weekly. I came for a peach black tea, and it was on point as usual. I like to add a little of agave into my iced tea, better than sugar. The staff and the patrons are always so kind. The service is great and the food is delicious. I wish I could live downtown just so I can live near jobot.

I've been coming to jobot for years, and recently the quality has really declined. The venue is cooler sure but I paid an additional $2 today for a crepe that is only 2 inches wide? They used to be full and delicious but now I'm paying more for just boring dough. I've left pretty upset and hungry the last few times and I probably won't come back. Sorry to see you go jobot. You used to be my #1.
Coffee was average. I did get the hipster vibe when I found the place. Did not get a chance to try the food but probably won't be returning.

My co-worker ranted about this breakfast spot but couldn't tell me the name, just location. He said the pancakes melted in your mouth and you didn't even need syrup. Luckily there was yelp to help narrow it down and I found JoBot!! Very welcoming, great environment, and good food. The pancakes were delicious and the orange juice was fresh squeezed. 

I know the area and environment isn't to kid oriented, but a booster would've been nice. My one year old sat in my lap and we ate together.

Was in search of another local business to give my monies to and saw good reviews for Jobot Coffee in downtown Phoenix and I experienced poor customer service. From the time I posted videos of the coffee shop's aesthetic to my "hangry" mood kicking in, I spent a whopping 45 minutes waiting on a breakfast sandwich. When I asked the cashier for a refund, he did just that. No apology, no ownership, no customer service. Take your dollars else where my friends. Looks like I'll be back at my favorite coffee shop. I'm pissed and hungry af

This place has changed slowly for the better.  They have not lost the charm of their rustic roots as they have literally opened their space to accommodate their growing fan base.   
Their food is spot on.  It is not just about the crepes here you can get those same items as tacos, sandwiches or salads.  But I stick to the crepes.  Their desserts are made in house and are pretty lovely.  Their daily specials are usually my go to as I have tried just about everything on their menu.  

If I could give 6 stars it would be for their CHAI!  Oh those m*th#rF*cK#rs have ruined me for life by serving me some of THE BEST CHAI EVER!! I can no longer go to any other place and have the swill they sell as chai. JoBot brews the tea fresh and they have their own spice blend that they add at the initiation of each order.  That being the case I ask for it to be extra spicy and they add a few extra shakes of that magical blend of spices.  
A squeeze of honey and a half pump of vanilla syrup round out this luscious libation.  They only had 2 milk choices, soy and regular,  in the early phases of the establishment.  Now as they develop,they have added almond.  Thank you! 

If you are looking for a super early morning munch or super late night eats, this is one of the VERY FEW places in the area that can accommodate that need.  

Don't forget your roots JoBot.  Don't loose your charm or sell out to "the man".   You are one of the businesses that anchors RoRo and represents the charm and character that is this 'hood.

A great find based on Yelp ratings for stopping when driving through Phoenix. I'll definitely stop through again.

Delicious crepes. Even when another group destroyed their banana reserve and we had to do the strawberries instead. (We got a side of the ricotta and jam to soften the blow. That ricotta is awesome!)

Breakfast burrito was generous, with a nice balance of the fillings (pico, potatoes, etc.) and the breakfast sandwich, while not as big, was yummy and quickly devoured.

We really enjoyed speaking with the baristas - welcoming was using by another Yelper and I've got to agree. Not all of the available art was to my taste but I love seeing walls with original pieces.
Kharli made the best Old Fashioned. She's the best server.  Other people there are OK too.

Today was my fourth time here and the food was amazing as always. I ordered the breakfast sandwich and my boyfriend had the steak and eggs. I ordered my sandwich w.o tomatoes but it came with them. Not a big deal, just picked them off. The lattes and mochas are delicious. It's nice because you can bring your dog on the patio. The only reason I don't give 5 stars is because I DONT ENJOY having smoke blown in my face while I eat.

This place fits the hipster and urban vibe perfectly!  Their italian sodas, coffee, and Chicken Chop Salad (one of the freshest salads I've ever eaten) are all amazing! I love coming there to study, hangout, and eat!! It's open basically all of the time and is pretty decently priced in general and especially for the quality.

I was staying in an airbnb next door to this place.  I was in need of some breakfast and coffee.  I found this wonderful gem, the great thing is that it is not only a coffee place but it has a bar as well!! The staff is so nice and it is wonderful seeing the owner working in the kitchen and being part of his place.  If you are in the area I would check this place out!!
Chicken curry: It was pretty good! Wish there was a bigger portion, or maybe I was just hungry and it was good! New location is great, good diverse crowd, modern/hipster vibe, good city views.

This is my favorite coffee spot in all of Phoenix! People here are always cool, lots of cool art, the coffee is delicious. They have good and a bar as well but I only get coffee here. People gather here with friends to chat or with their laptops to do work. Friendly staff. Not always the most attentive but nice! Definitely recommend it!

Horrendous hipster "coffee" house playing obnoxious music. 

Probably the worst cappuccino I've ever had - incredibly bitter. 

The Nutella crepe was nothing special - they couldn't even take the time to distribute the Nutella evenly so there were giant blobs here and there and some parts completely lacking.

Been coming here for years. It's a downtown staple so if you are visiting, make sure you drop by. Located on 5th street, you can experience the true heart of the downtown artists community in one place (although there are legitimate pockets of culture all over downtown). 

Very good iced coffee, delicious cinnamon sugar VEGAN cookies, and drip coffee to make you JUMP! JUMP! These are the only things I have here, but everything looks good. 

If you're open minded and friendly, come here! You'll be in good company.

This is in that cool neighborhood that reminds me Seattle or another big city with history, but nothing like Phoenix.  Very hippy style.  The building is an old converted house (from the 1940s?) that looks like something out of an old Boston or Seattle neighborhood, but not Phoenix.  The menu is hippy-ish as well.  They have these strange wraps and crepes.  I had a philly one.  It was okay.  I think next time I would get a more dessert style crepe with cinnamon and sugar or something.  Phillys don't really work as crepes.  Interesting little place worth stopping in just to check out how weird it is.  Lol.

Ah Jobot..... I have always wanted to be a fan......It just seems like such a 'cool' place.  I've visited periodically over the years and most recently visited their new location in the old Oliver's coffee shop. The new location is an interesting mix of Jobot's old style and a more modern coffee shop. The baristas are friendly and helpful..... I just don't think their coffee tastes that good..... I know that's a personal preference thing, but Cartel coffee just doesn't do it for me. I do want to return to try their food again and possibly visit the bar, but I think their coffee is just ok.

I came here this morning with the BF to use a living social deal I had bought recently. I was really excited to try this place, as it was crazy busy the last time I was there (on first friday), so I passed on it. This place is really cool, it has a nice atmosphere and feels homey and friendly. The whole street is like a little community, so it has a good feel, and I like to support that kind of business. I ordered an iced latte and the 'cannoli' crepe (ricotta, choco chips, almonds) and the BF got a hot latte and the PB, raspberry jam, and banana crepe. They were a bit chewy, but good flavor. The coffee was very good, it is made by cartel coffee, which I always like. I would definitely come back here to try different flavors and to drink yummy coffee.

I am so disappointed, I absolutely loved the last location and now I will never go again. Their menu downgraded drastically, along with customer service. I ordered a crepe and my boyfriend got bacon. They put them in the same box so I got bacon grease all over my crepe (I'm a vegetarian) and he got powdered sugar covered bacon. I'm really sad I can't go to my favorite casual spot for some amazing pancakes and awesome vibes anymore. Should have stayed put.

We stumbled across this coffee shop after an all-day out and about excursion in South Mountain and Desert Botanical Garden. All I wanted was to refuel a little before meeting up with friends for dinner.  Then I saw the magical word "crepes" as the car drove by this part of downtown. 

I like local places, especially ones with characters. This fits the bill.  I had a giant iced coffee for $3.50 and a classic crepe (lemon juice and powder sugar) for $3.50 as well.  It beats any Starbucks or whatever chain there is. We sat outside, and see that this place must appeal to the artsy crowd. There were plenty of people drawing and doing their "thang" on their laptop.   The crepe was ok, probably should have gone with a more elaborate option (they have a lot of savory and sweet options for $8). I was at this point on a caffeine high since I sucked down that coffee like it was water.

Inside wasn't air conditioned and didn't have much comfy seating options, but it offers the important function of charging my dying phone. 

Visitors: visit this area, there are lots of cool little joints (coffee, shops, restaurants, and a bodega) and stop by JoBot for a cup of Jo

Big fan of the music selection  the environment was pretty sweet and the mix of demographics that were in there were pretty cool to see. Everyone from all walks of life just enjoying being under the same roof as everyone else

So I checked out this place with a coworker of mine and we will defnitely be going back.  The area is decent.  The coffee house is quite literally a house that serves coffee.  They do have a menu and we checked out the crepes which were delicious as well.  The setting outside makes you feel at home in this hipster kind of area.  I felt like I was in my front yard just chatting with my girlfriend.  

There is one slight downfall and that was while we were there a few homeless people were lurking and I had the wonderful fortune of watching use the restroom across the street.  I will say with that it does not deter me from going back to this place and trying more of the menu or drinks.  The people were moderately friendly and I like that side of town in general.  

Strawberry and banana crepes with Nutella (delicious!).
This is one of those places that people think is cool but beneath the surface there's no substance- food and drink is subpar or mediocre and service is really bad.
My new favorite place!  I've been there 4 times now, and am 4/4.  The Turkey Melt is bomb as are the Crapes.  Looking forward to navigating through the entire menu in my near future!

I generally avoid this spot. With so many great independent coffee shops in Phoenix, putting up with the "too cool for school" attitude of this place just doesn't seem worth it. Per a friends request, I ignored previous bad experiences and decided to give them another chance. After ordering a latte, I realized they didn't have honey on their condiment bar. When I asked for honey I was literally scolded for not ordering the honey latte as the barista rudely squeezed honey into my cup spilling my drink all over the counter. 1. There are tactful ways to communicate information that seem to be beyond the baristas intellectual abilities and 2. I'm sorry that your parents gave you the basic white girl name of Chandler and you feel like you need to be rude to maintain your street cred. This place tries way too hard to be the bastion of cool and unfortunately it's nothing more than yet another hipster with a parliament light and bad attitude. Get over yourself Jobot.

Don't go here. I got the peach black tea and it tasted like nothing. So weak. I thought the daily brunch special was good and substantial. Everyone else ordered from the menu. The portions were miniscule.  My friends hungry man breakfast had a tablespoon of potatoes. The outdoor patio had a homeless man smoking and feeding the pigeons. He was ranting to himself

I can't wait to go try the crepes! I was only here to get a quick drink.
Sooooooo glad for the patio! Can't wait to take Dexter. :}
Crepe's heaven! Super hipster. nice comfy place to relax and have a bite, or some coffee. awesome service and simple atmosphere.

Came here on a Sunday morning and there was a sizeable crowd, but not too crowded. It was a colder day, so not a lot of people sitting outside. Our group of 4 was able to find a table in the back corner after ordering our crepes. There was a much larger group seated already so this place can definitely handle groups.

I had the Philly crepe and the banana nutella crepe. For the price, it can't be beat. I think they have a small kitchen and thus the wait can be long. $7 for all savory crepes and $6 for sweet, the wait is worth it. The service is great and this street is cool, being inside of an old house. Parking was easy. The scene is definitely hipster.

Honestly, this is hands down one of my favorite breakfast spots. I go here before class in the mornings and get the Chorizo buscuits and gravy. It comes with a side of really yummy potatoes covered in what tastes like a taziki sauce. I also love how even though I get a iced mocha it still has the coffee taste I like, unlike most places where they are smothered in syrup. Get here early because they do get packed.

My husband and I came here on a date night and we had such a nice time. We both enjoyed a cappuccino and they were on point. The barista even remade one for us before we even treated it because she wanted to make sure it was perfect. I love that this place is open late. They have great music. As some have mentioned, it is a hipster vibe, however, not at all pretentious. Everyone is very friendly and the crowd diverse. I will go back to try their breakfast.
the greatest coolest place i discovered on my visit to phoenix! crepes or tacos with cool combinations that are italian or greek.. loved the concept and the food itself!

I love this place!
There's this wonderful Barista who has dark shorter hair, she's tall with glasses and tattoos. Don't let her dark and ominous description detour you...She makes super awesome drinks! Sometimes she has a riddle prepared! Once I needed a jolt after studying for finals and she made me a drink and wrote a encouraging note with the a werthers original attached to it.

I was all like "Santa is that you?" And she was like "nope just your friendly local barista!"
I'm not well on my way to getting my doctorate because of the amazing staff and drinks at Jobot!!

I first spent money here when I found myself stranded downtown on a Friday night. "How late are you open on the weekends?" I asked, "24 hours", the energetic and gregarious pixie behind the counter proclaimed with great pride.  It has been a love affair ever since.

Good coffee, great crepes(and I grew up on a crepe farm, I know), and an atmosphere that could be described as "Twisted...but in a good way."

My only word of caution would be to keep in mind that this place is a loud party, all of the time, so if you are easily distracted by music and well styled bohemians, then you may want to stick to the library to write your blogs or do your homework.

Decided to try this place randomly since my sorority sister and I were in the area. We weren't big breakfast fans and I was really craving eggs. They had awards for their crepes so of course, since most of the items on the small menu were heavy anyway, we decided on sweet crepes with strawberries and nutella and I got eggs on the side. Surprisingly the crepe was delicious. It was so warm, soft, and fluffy with sweet strawberry and nutella balancing it perfectly because it wasn't too sweet. I also thought that the side of egg would come with only 1 egg however, it came with 2 and was cooked perfectly. And to top it all off, it was pretty cheap. This diner is definitely a hidden gem and has potential for success.

If you're in the area, definitely stop by!

More 3.5 than 3.  Went with a living social coupon, so I got to order lots of things to cover the 20.  Had the turkey pesto mozzarella crepe, and i must say, it was excellent. The  staff recommended it, and it did not disappoint.  I appreciated that he was more excited about recommending it than me ordering it.  Also ordered a vanilla scone, and it was pretty good as well.  I drank a  mocha, which I didn't find that special, hence minus 1 star.  the other star deduction was for the crazy heat inside...they don't have ac.  However, I'll say that their food is pretty solid...and, when the weather eventually cools a little, that star will go up.  

I also had a machaca crepe. That was really good. The pico de gallo had amazing flavor and spice...much better than 95% of the Mexican restaurants I've been to in Phoenix.

Terrible service. Pricing on signs in-store are never accurate. A girl who goes by the name of "Gypsy" that has been at the counter every time we have patronized this business at their new location is very rude, lackadaisical, and very much so intimidated by the African women she so desperately tries to imitate and who's culture she appropriates. We will never patronize this business again after the poor customer service we have received and the very non-caring and non-customer service oriented attitude we received from the owner.
The food was really good but I can't stand restaurants that expect you to clean up your own dishes. If I had known I wouldn't have tipped.
Great coffee, friendly staff, and fair prices. Was surprised it was in a multi use building, but that didn't take away much from the overall feel. Pretty big food, alcohol, and coffee menu

I go here once a month on First Friday. The coffee is good- really good. But whenever I ask questions about the menu - I get accosted. I like sweet coffee drinks! So sue me! My recent trip was with a flippant young woman. She was more interested in gossiping than providing customer service. 

I also ordered cake balls--- which were yummy. Their food is great.

My point is, the product is quality  - but when you have to worry about interrupting the staff to order - there is a problem. The product is good, my latte was a work of art-- but I don't want to be uncomfortable to get it.

Please work on your customer service Jobot! Even though the product is good- it's hard to give you more stars with the unfriendliness.

Love it. Menu is greatly expanded since I was last here and its fantastic. Lots of options from crepes to sandwiches to omelettes to baked goods. Of course full coffee bar. I also love that they're open all night Friday and Saturday. Five stars!

Rating primarily for vibe, character of the place, location, and nice staff.  Great place to study.  I confess I was disappointed with the messy espresso shot that was pulled for me, and the coffee was just ok too.  Everything else made me happy though.

One of my favorite places to grab a quick coffee. The salads are very tasty and overall has a very positive vibe. 

The one thing that I would mention is that the baristas can be rude at times, a few times being approached with a "What do you want?" versus a polite "what can I get for you?" There is a distinction with the service and customer service but I support local business.
Oh my God this is the worst bathroom I've ever been in. Glad they are open for all these crazy drunks on First Friday but while they really need some more servers and help to clean up the place

Very nice location and great space. The iced chai latte was pretty good too. Why the 3 stars and not 5? They had a DJ the early afternoon I came to watch YouTube videos on my tablet. His music selection was quite good which I can rarely say about most such events. However, this is still primarily a cafe and not a club, unless that's what they're going for. Besides, it was early Sunday afternoon. I measured the sound pressure level several times with an app on my phone and it averaged between 87 decibels (average motorcycle) to 90 decibels (average food blender) inside so I did my work outside in the heat. Unless you're among obnoxious drunk loud talkers, you will have a very hard time hearing each other here. If I come here again, I'll wear ear plugs or go down the street and choose from among many other places if it's loud again. There are many non-club venues such as cafes that have a DJ playing these days, but they usually play at a reasonable volume or as background music. This DJ however needs to turn the volume WAY down!

Short bar girl was beyond rude. Very unwelcoming and had a bad attitude. I would never go back, as I thought the service was horrible and very unprofessional. When I asked for a manger, I was told one was not on duty. I am waiting for a call back from one.

Sweet little place in Phoenix - very cozy. Counter service is very friendly and our hot cocoas were just about the best around. I had a simple lemon & powdered sugar crepe. It was cooked with a delicate hand and almost a tiny bit eggy in flavor. Smashing. Hubby had one with bacon, turkey, sweet cherries, and cheese - oh my goodness  - what an amazing combination. Sweet and savory and absolutely rich with flavor. I wouldn't hesitate to stop in again for the relaxed vibe, friendly service, and good eats.

Delicious coffee and some good food, too.  I love crepes for breakfast but I have never before had crepes with Machaca or chorizo... and served with salsa that had a good kick to it, too.  The hubby appreciated the fact that you could get all the same options with corn tortillas instead.  We did not try the scones but they looked fantastic.

The coffee is really good. The iced coffee is especially good.

The crepes are pretty hilarious concoctions. My friends and I call them "stoner crepes." They're REALLY good, just very strange. My favorite is the #9. Just get the #9 and you'll have a good rest of your day.

The atmosphere is cool. I agree with most of the reviewers here, it can seem a little pretentious right off the bat, but the more you go.. the less you care about that.

FINALLY we find a 24 hour coffee shop.  Tired of going out and wanting coffee after 10 pm only to find the only place is Dennys for coffee -ick.  Heard about Jobot -  nice local coffee house on the newly refurbished Roosevelt row.  Also serve food 24 hours.  Lots of artists and urban hipsters but a damn fine cup of coffee after 10 pm.

This place is very hipster! It does a great job of catering to the hipster techie or student. I wasn't crazy about it though because the food menu is minimal and somewhat caters to a particular palate. The burrito was great but the lighting was poor.
Great little neighborhood spot for coffee dates, late night eats, or First Friday fun

The new Jobot is nothing like the old. I love that they're still going but the DJ makes it impossible to have a conversation at all, so I just go there to do work now. The wifi is also spotty and drops out all the time for my electronics. I love the idea of Jobot and enjoy their coffee. Five stars if it weren't so loud.

Late Night Problems... there are those nights at 2 am when every thing with edible food is closed.  You pull out your mobile Yelp app.  You search for restaurants that are open now.... and just some times, you find a rare 5-Star gem and wonder,  "How could I have not found this place before today."  JoBot Coffee is one of those places.

Everything about JoBot screams hipster.  It is in an ecclectic part of down town Phoenix, they serve as much local food as possible,  it sits next door to a house-pub, it is in a house itself and  the inside is retro-shic.  AND It is open 24 hours on the weekends.  I fell so deep in love with this place that I wanted to bring my cot and blanket and move in.  

The selection of crepes and specials is phenomenal.   You walk up to the counter and order something good.  This IS a coffee shop, so expect brekfast-like options with tasty salads and other things.  Sit at the counter or a table inside or stroll to a table outside on the front lawn.... enjoy food.  Repeat.  Repeat.

I can't wait for my return to this restaurant.  I am sure there are more exciting things about this place that I have yet to discover.
A cozy little coffee shop with some of the most mouthwatering crepes I've ever experienced. If you're in the area it is worth the stop

I've been going here for about 4 years now so I feel my review actually has a fair amount of experience here. The BIGGEST turn off is the people. If you are a hipster or snob you will fit right in! Never once in all the time I have come here has any of the staff been friendly or helpful. First, You work in a customer service oriented industry so stop moaning about how hard it is living in your parents basement because they tell you to turn down your indie records and slap a smile on your face! Second, if I'm paying $5 for a coffee it better be good service and good coffee. It's not that hard to grasp. Now on to the coffee.. It is good coffee but certainly not the best phoenix has to offer . Mocha and their chai is the best on the menu imo. It's worth at least one visit  because it's a great area to walk around and is in a funky shop inside of a historic house so there's lots of character all around. The Crepes they offer are very good if you're hungry as well as some of their fresh baked pastries. All in all Jobot is a decent coffee shop but like I said the staff and "local crowd" that hangs there is far from enjoyable.

Alright, I should hardly be reviewing this place since all I had was one iced Chai Tea Latte and an Apple/Granola Crepe...but I had to say something about it.  What I have to say is finally!!!...There is finally a place on Roosevelt and/or 5th street that you can sit outside and eat at!  This place already has a pretty cool menu filled of crepes and coffee drinks which will sit perfectly with locals once they master their skills of service.  Things seem to still be a little "new" there but once they get it, this place won't be going anywhere. Thank you JoBot for adding an interesting little place to downtown Phoenix.

This is by far my favorite coffee shop in the Phoenix Metroplex. 

It's a house.

They serve food. It's delicious.

Get the Toddy(Cold-brewed coffee). It's my fave.
